campaign.story:
Welcome Back to the House of Fear!
We're back with our 7th issue of House of Fear, and our 5th Kickstarter campaign!
House of Fear blends everything you love about Goosebumps, Scooby-Doo, and Tales From the Crypt. Each issue features complete, stand-alone stories that are always exciting, sometimes humorous, and occasionally downright scary.
(Okay,  it's not that scary. There are no nightmares here. But we've learned that young readers love the idea of reading comics their parents think are too scary for them.) 
We're using this Kickstarter campaign to raise funds to print the 33-page issue, House of Fear: Rubber & Glue, and hopefully, we'll hit a couple of Stretch Goals along the way for some additional items. 
What's it About?
Our first story, "Rubber & Glue," introduces us to a couple of students from Savini Middle School.
Caden and Isaac aren't exactly friends. 
And everything is most certainly not okay here. 
Caden thinks he has the upper hand, as always. But this time, he's in for a shock. Isaac isn't just repeating a childish retort...
...but instead is casting a curse. One that will force Caden to live a day in the life of the bullied. 
This story isn't the Monster-of-the-Month fare you've come to expect from House of Fear, but instead, examines the roles we play in middle school, and shines light on just how easy a harmless prank becomes something worse. It's as if Stephen King wrote an after-school special. 
This issue also features a backup story, "The Trees Have Eyes." This one starts peacefully enough, with Tosh and his dad out for a pleasant hike in the woods. 
Well, maybe not so peaceful or pleasant for Dad. And when they venture off the trail...
...and into a copse of aspen trees, things take a turn for the worse.
Trust me, you'll never look at Aspen trees the same again. 
What to Expect
Here's what you can expect when you back our latest campaign:
One issue featuring two complete, stand-alone stories.
33 pages of full-color thrills.
Fun, exciting comics suitable for (almost) all ages.
Bagged/boarded comics shipped in sturdy packaging.
We print House of Fear domestically, which means a faster turn around time (within 2 months of the campaign end).  
We're now printing on a heavy 70 lb paper stock with a 100 lb cover stock.  A heavier stock means the comics stand up to multiple reads and make the book more suitable for sharing. 
Stretch and Milestone Goals
We recently had our 175th backer, which means every backer gets a set of print-at-home activity pages. This set includes prompts for kids to draw their own monsters and comics, and of course, also includes coloring pages. 
If we reach 200 backers, all backers will receive a PDF of the B&W version of The Trees Have Eyes. See Jethro's line work in all its glory in this special version of the story. 
If we reach 225 backers, I'll upgrade the Digital Deluxe PDF to a full, behind-the-scenes, making of book. I received lots of feedback after our last campaign for this style of book, and I'm excited for the opportunity to do it again for Rubber & Glue.
Our First Kickstarter Exclusive Variant
We're big fans of the old EC comics, so for this campaign, we created our first variant cover as an homage to those horror comics from the 50s. Those are James Hislope's lines, and Josh Jensen's colors, with Matt Krotzer on letters and design. They absolutely nailed it, didn't they?
As a way to reward backers with a piece of House of Fear history, the variant is an exclusive to Kickstarter. We'll print to order (with an overage of 10% to cover possible damage during transit), so don't expect too many of these to make it to my online shop or to convention tables. 
The Rare, Serialized Variant
We've also got a rare variant for this campaign. This one features art by Jethro Morales and colors by Josh Jensen. There will be no House of Fear trade dress on the cover. Just the frightful artwork. 
Each copy will be individually serialized to only 31 copies. 
Boyle Minifig
We've partnered with Justin at Saber-Scorpion to produce a limited-edition Boyle minifig. The look and accessories are specific to this issue and will only be made available during this campaign. 
The image below is a prototype of what you can expect.
Exclusive, Crossover Print
Our first House of Fear crossover is here! Anyone who backs a physical reward for this campaign and the one for Phil Falco's Haunting 1-3 will receive this exclusive print, signed by the writers on both books. (Digital backers who back both will receive a digital version of the art.)
Stunning art by Jethro Morales and Josh Jensen
Haunting is a solid, supernatural horror comic for teens and adults. So if you have older kids in your house or if you like to sample new horror for yourself, now's the time to try something new!  
 The Rewards 
Add Ons
If you've backed a print tier, you can add additional print copies of House of Fear: Rubber & Glue. You can also catch up on all of the House of Fear comics with the Digital Catch Up add on. We have stickers, too!
After you select a tier to back, Kickstarter will take you to the Add-On page. If you see another issue you'd like to have, simple select it from the Add-On page. 
Other print issues of House of Fear will be available as add-on options after the campaign has ended.
Preview Pages
Below are pages from House of Fear: Rubber & Glue.
Shipping and Delivery
Our young readers aren't overly concerned with mint comics. All they care about is reading the story....and rereading it as many times as possible. 
But there are a lot of collectors reading House of Fear, too. We know true horror is getting a Kickstarter package in the mail and finding a crumpled comic inside.
With that in mind, we pack our books with the same care we used in making the book and the love that we have for our backers.
All comics come bagged and boarded. 
Any order that consists of 1 or 2 comics will be shipped in a sturdy, oversize envelope (stay flat mailers from Pratt Plus). 
All orders of 3 or more comics will be shipped in a Gemini Mailer for added protection. 
All packages will be sent via USPS Media Mail, First Class, or Priority Mail, depending on weight.
Timeline and Budget
The comic is 100% complete, so all we need to do is send the issue and sticker sheet to the printers. After 2-3 weeks, I'll start shipping everything to backers. 
But where do the funds go?
About half of the funds we earn through Kickstarter will be used to print the comic and other rewards. Shipping will take approximately 40% of the funds we receive, and 10% goes to Kickstarter for hosting the campaign.
Any extra money we earn from the campaign will help pay for future issues of House of Fear.
 Meet the Creators 
Will You Help Us Make Comics for Kids?
It's simple: We love making fun, exciting comics, and we want to get them to as many readers as I possibly can. We can't do that without support from readers like you.
Thank you for checking out our latest project. We hope you find a reward that suits you well, and when you do, that you back the campaign and help us continue making exciting, action-packed comics for kids.
Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my FIFTH Kickstarter campaign! The comic is already complete, and all we have left to do is print the comic and other rewards. 

We're big fans of the Kickstarter platform, and we know how important it is for backers to get their rewards in a timely manner. So we plan to do everything we can to meet your expectations. Of course, if anything comes up that throws us off schedule, we will keep Kickstarter backers updated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
If you filled out the survey, you should have received your digital and physical House of Fear rewards. If you haven't, please send me a note. 
I've been getting great feedback on the issue, and I hope you enjoyed it as much as the others. 
What's Next?

A brief shipping update:  
If you filled out a survey, I've shipped your rewards. 
Well, except for locals...I plan to hand-deliver your comics.  
I sent all digital rewards through email, not through Kickstarter messages. If you don't see an email from james@jameswpowell.com, please check your spam folder.  
Reach out if you have any comments, concerns, or questions.  
After you read the issue, let me know what you thought. I enjoy hearing what our readers like and don't like.

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys out, comics on the way
updates.update_content:
A few quick updates on House of Fear: Rubber & Glue:
I sent surveys on Friday, and over 150 backers have responded already!
If you want your name on the Thank You page of the PDF, please respond by April 18. 
The stickers are already printed and in hand. 
Justin is finishing up the Boyle minifigs and they'll be here early next week.
The comics are being printed this week, and in hand next week.

Our House of Fear campaign might have ended, but there's still time to get in on the exclusive crossover print we have with Phil Falco's Haunting. (Not much time, though...there's only 2 days remaining.)

Kickstarter is still dealing with the finances from the campaign, but I haven't let that slow me down. This week I've:
Submitted my information to the printer to get rolling on comic printing
Sent the final files for printing the stickers
Paid Justin so he could start creating those magnificent Bolye minifigs 
Secured more bags and boards for shipping

Thank you again for supporting House of Fear. We're excited for you to check out the latest issue. 
So what's next?
1. Those backers whose pledges failed have five days to fix their pledges. There are 5-6 backers whose credit cards failed. If that's you, please take a moment to update your credit card information on Kickstarter.

We did it! Our latest issue of House of Fear has officially been funded on Kickstarter!
And by we, I truly mean you, me, the creators on the issue, and everyone who backed the campaign. Thank you so much for having faith in us and in the House of Fear series. I'm so grateful for the Kickstarter and comic community. 
Up next for me, well, I just want to relax, smile, and feel the love. I'll hop back on in a few days with information about what's next.

updates.update_userinfo: One backer from the 2nd most backed HoF campaign!
updates.update_content:
We only have about 24 hours left, but if we get one more backer, we'll have made this House of Fear campaign our second most backed campaign to date. 
I know, we don't celebrate being second best that often, right? 
But for me, right now, it's a big deal. I took a year off from all things creative and all things online, so I feel like I'm starting over these last few months. And to get back to those loftier numbers again absolutely makes this feel like the right thing to be doing.

campaign.story:
Welcome Back to the House of Fear! 
The series that introduces young readers to the thrills of scary comics is back! This time, our young heroes face off against spiders. Lots and lots of spiders!
In "The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs," Maeve is dreadfully scared of spiders. But when her younger brother is captured by the evil exterminator and his clutter of arachnids, she must overcome her fear to save him...and the world.
What Do You Get?
Our comics blend everything you love about Goosebumps, Scooby-Doo, and Tales From the Crypt. House of Fear was created as a way to introduce kids to scary stories, but our comics are great for anyone who likes fun, exciting fantasy-adventure comics. 
Here's what you can expect when you back our latest campaign:
A complete, stand-alone, 32-page comic.
A story suitable for all ages.
Off-set printing for highest quality.
Bagged/boarded comics shipped in sturdy packaging.
I'm confident you and your family will enjoy our comics. So confident, in fact, we guarantee your satisfaction.  
If you back the printed version and dislike the comics for any reason, return them for a refund (minus shipping fees).
And these comics are already printed, so back with 100% confidence. Check out the limited edition matte covers. The matte cover with the shiny logo looks fantastic.
The matte covers have spot gloss on the title. They look incredible. And the cover stock is a little thicker, too, which is a nice bonus for collectors and children.
What Critics Are Saying  
In 2019, Dark Horse Comics published a collection of House of Fear stories. 
When the book hit shops, we received good feedback from readers and critics. Here's what they were saying about it online... 
Preview Pages
Enjoy this preview of House of Fear: The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs. 
Why Quickstarter?
Not long after our last campaign, the House of Fear team created "The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs." We had the Kickstarter page nearly complete, but the timing didn't quit work out. And then, when Covid hit, comics were moved to the back burner for awhile.
Despite having already printed the rewards, we held off on launching until we made progress on future comics. Our goal for this short campaign is to reintroduce the series to readers, and get a jump start on creating more issues in 2021.
The Rewards   
Receive a PDF version of House of Fear: The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs.
Receive a print copy of House of Fear: The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs.
Get two copies of House of Fear: The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs. Perfect for collectors or those with 2-child households.
Get a signed and numbered copy of the 100-page novella, Santa's Claws. Also receive the rare orange matte variant of Mr. Skinny Legs, plus the limited edition green matte cover, too.
Have your pitch or Kickstarter page reviewed by a professional editor! This reward includes a thorough edit and review, plus a Zoom session to discuss the feedback. Plus all of the print and digital rewards.
Have your 22-page comic script edited by a professional editor! Includes a substantive edit of your script, with detailed written comments, plus a Zoom session to discuss the feedback. Also includes the print and digital rewards.
Is your son or daughter an artist? If so, they can design the monster for an upcoming issue of House of Fear. Includes a family Zoom session to discuss the project, plus email updates for each step in the comic-creation process. Includes the Mr. Skinny Legs print and digital rewards.
Is you son or daughter interested in making comics? With this reward, they can be a part of the entire process. Includes a family Zoom session to discuss ideas, plot, and characters for the comic, plus regular email updates for each step in the process. Also includes all Mr. Skinny Legs print and digital rewards.
Black Friday Deals
I've added two Black Friday reward tiers that feature the House of Fear Dark Horse collected edition. I have limited quantities, so if you're looking for a signed copy of the Dark Horse book, act now.
Received a signed copy of the House of Fear Dark Horse collected edition, plus two copies of the standard Mr. Skinny Legs (and the digital rewards, too).
Received a signed copy of the House of Fear Dark Horse collected edition, plus the limited orange matte cover, and the green matte cover (plus the digital rewards).
Milestone Bonus
When the campaign reaches 100 backers, every backer will also receive a look behind the scenes. Call it a director's cut, a digital-deluxe version, or a making-of supplement, but this book will be more than just a script book. More than just a handful of sketches and inked pages, too.
For this digital book, I've pulled together all the resources I have from when we made the comic, including the various stages of the script, art changes and the discussions about them, character descriptions, sample colors, and so much more. 
Add Ons  
After you select a reward tier, Kickstarter will ask if you'd like to add any other rewards. If you backed a physical reward level, you can add one or more of these House of Fear comics.
Where do the Funds Go?
Because the rewards are already printed and ready to go, the bulk of the funding will be used for shipping, packaging costs, and Kickstarter fees. All remaining money will help us fund the creation of future issues of House of Fear.
What About Shipping?
All comics are individually bagged and boarded. 
Any order that consists of 1 or 2 comics will be shipped in a sturdy, oversize envelope (stay flat mailers from Pratt Plus). These will be shipped via First Class Mail. 
All orders of 3 or more comics will be shipped in a Gemini Mailer for added protection. These packages will be shipped via Priority Mail. 
Meet the Creators
Will You Help Us Make More Comics?
It's simple: We want to make more fun, exciting comics and get them to as many readers as we possibly can. And we can't do that without support from readers like you.
Thank you for checking out our latest project. I hope you find a reward that suits you well, and when you do, that you back the campaign and help us continue making action-packed comics for kids of all ages.
Thank you!

We're putting the final touches on the seventh issue of House of Fear, and I'm excited to announce that we're launching our next campaign in early March. 
House of Fear: Rubber & Glue is a 32-page issue featuring two complete stories that feature bullies, curses, and a forest of evil eyes and demented trees.
Click here to be notified when we launch.

updates.update_userinfo: (Almost) All comics have been delivered...and a contest
updates.update_content:
I just checked my shipping reports, and all but three of the reward packages I sent have been delivered...and those three are all overseas. I expect the final shipments to be delivered in the next week or two.
If you're in the United States and haven't received your House of Fear rewards yet, let me know. And if you're international and haven't seen your rewards by the end of the month, give me a shout.
In other news, we're gearing up for another campaign. The next one will feature 2 stories. I hope to launch that by the end of next month, so look for news and preview images soon.

I just spent the morning generating mailing labels for the House of Fear Kickstarter packages. My head is spinning a little, to be honest. Whew. 
All packages labeled today (Monday) will ship tomorrow. 
There are about 10 backers who haven't filled out their survey. If that's you, log into Kickstarter and respond as soon as you can. It's the only way I can see your mailing address.

We're about a week from Kickstarter transferring funds from the House of Fear campaign, but I'll be sending out surveys later today. Please submit your responses as soon as you can so I can get your books shipped out quickly. 
As you can see below, all the rewards are packed up and ready to go. I just need addresses for the labels.

updates.update_userinfo: The end is only the beginning
updates.update_content:
The House of Fear campaign has come to an end, but for me, it's only just beginning. I won't consider this campaign a success until every backer has received their reward. To get there, I've got some work to do.
Here's a quick look at what's next:
While Kickstarter is collecting funds and doing the backend processing, I'll get started packaging the books. That way, when the funds transfer to me, I can print the shipping labels and get them in the mail as quickly as possible.

We've got a few hours left in our House of Fear campaign, and I wanted to say thank you. It's been a rough year for so many of us, and here we are, hosting a Kickstarter campaign. At the start of holiday season no less. 
We appreciate the support, and we're excited to make more fun, exciting comics in 2021. We've learned a lot during the last 10 days, too, and we have some cool plans for future Kickstarter campaigns.

We're down to the final 24 hours. Our House of Fear campaign ends at 10:31 local time Monday morning (I have a thing for the numbers 10 and 31, apparently). 
If you know of friends who might be interested in our comics, please let them know that time is running out.
In other news, I was on the Don't Try: Making It Happen podcast with Andrew Guilde. It was an absolute blast. We had a fun conversation about our process for writing comics, what it's like to deal with self doubt, and the joy of working with kids. I'll be honest, it's a long show, so maybe listen at the gym or on a long walk. But if you're interested in the craft, I think it's worth a listen.

updates.update_content:
I had set up two Black Friday reward tiers that feature the Dark Horse collected edition. My intent was to set them with limited quantities and for a limited duration. But I realized I set them to expire in six hours, not 24. D'oh!
So I've gone ahead and posted the deals again. But this time, there's no time limit. Unless you realize that the campaign ends in 48 hours, in which case, yeah, time is indeed running out.

It's Thanksgiving here in the States, and I wanted to take a moment to tell you how much we appreciate you backing our latest House of Fear campaign.
We have a blast making these comics, but the real reward comes when others read them. Comics are all about collaboration, first when creators work together to develop the story, and then later between us and our readers. 
The more we share with our fans, and the more we hear/see/feel their support for our comics,  the more energized we are to keep making them.

 Experts in their field, years of hunting the rodents through the twisted streets of towns and cities, near and far. These mercenaries and peddlers of rodent disposal now stand on the precipice of fame and glory, all they have to do is their job, right?
OBJECTIVE
The Ratcatchers objective: To rid the city of as many rats as possible on their way to gathering as much Magical Cheese as possible.
WIN - The RATCATCHER is victorious if you achieve any one of the following criteria;
• The Ratcatcher collects 10 Magic Cheese or The Ratcatcher slays the Nemesis Rat
LOSE - The Ratcatcher is defeated if the Rats achieve one of the following criteria;
• The Rats consume 10 Magic Cheese or The Ratcatcher is reduced to 0 wounds

The Ratcatcher (Player) Turn: 
During your Ratcatchers turn, they’re seeking to vanquish rats & gather Magical Cheese. This can be done using the various skills and actions listed on the Character Board.   
Magic Cheese Tokens
Unlock/Upgrade:
Once the Ratcatcher can successfully gather some Magical Cheese then the fun of upgrading and customising your Ratcatcher can begin.  
By assigning a Magic Cheese you may unlock a chosen ability. Once active place the maximum number of the relevant tokens on the Character Board.
 The Rats (AI) Turn: 
Dependent on the type of Rat, the rats will either seek out the Magical Cheese or attack the Ratcatcher. White rats as the most numerous, and though simple in appearance their strength becomes apparent when they swarm towards pieces of cheese. Brown rats are vicious and ill tempered, set on attacking any who come close these rodents must be disposed of carefully. Black rats, are the breeders and with them comes even more rats. Each time a black rat is placed, additional rats are immediately placed. In addition to that each spawn phase Black rats count as a Spawn Point for even more rats! 
Peculiar Rats: 
The Magic Cheese can have wonderful and miraculous effects, this effect is not limited to humanity only. The rats are eating the cheese and it has had some peculiar effects on them.
The Peculiar rats imbue the power of the magic cheese forming a nasty mini boss style adversary that will complicate the Ratcatcher's quest but also offers a variety of tempting rewards should the Ratcatcher be bold enough to catch one. 
Nemesis Rats:
Nemesis Rats are true horrors of their species. The Magical Cheese has twisted their mind and body, into something spawned from the most terrible of nightmares. As catalysts of the Rat infection, destroying them is the of the utmost importance and seems the only logical path to freeing the kingdom.
Each Nemesis on top of having their own unique abilities, also has a varied Rat tracker. As the Rats collect Magic Cheese, this tracker will gain momentum, modifying the common rats, spawning Peculair rats and triggering the spawning of the Nemesis Rat. This makes each variant Nemesis a unique challenge.  
Expanding the Township:  
Township Cards - Tarot Sized Cards
The sprawling streets of Brie are the battle zone of The Ratcatcher. Filled with twists and turns it will require a keen eye to find the cheese & tactical choices to stay a head of the rat horde.  
If there are fewer than two Magic Cheese tokens in the city, then a mandatory Explore Action is undertaken. This will expand the city using additional township cards. Each new Township card will also add more cheese, opportunities to refill/recuperate & of course, more rats. 

 WHY PLEDGE NOW:
As with most projects using crowdfunding, The Ratcatcher solo adventure board game will not possible to publish without the financial commitment of backers. There are not only many costs to cover, but also the unpredictability of the market as well as gauging demand are all reasons Platypus Industries has come seeking funding via Kickstarter.
Subsidised shipping
Contribute the games content 
Unlock amazing via stretch goals such as extra content and quality upgrades for everyone!
Allow the Ratcatcher product line to get a strong start. There are plenty of plans for continued support & expansions, but only if the core set is funded.
Retailer Only

Keep track of the Ratcatcher's progress using Kicktraq
Aussie games design company set on creating top quality products that are unique, interesting & challenging.  
This is the first project to be launched by the company, but not our first game & definitely not our last. 
Matthew Aslin is the one-man show behind The Ratcatcher, Solo Adventure. He dwells in Melbourne, this is the first solo project but as with Platypus Industries it's unlikely to be his last.

Business Partners.
We are very lucky to be pairing with some amazing and very experienced companies to help us deliver our product in a way that is both high quality, swift & professional. 
Fulfilment: QML, Aetherworks, Logistico & VFI 
Manufacturing: HJM (China)
Pledge Manager:  
FAQ - Gameplay: 
 Solo mode only: Yes, that's right. This game is for one player only. During this Kickstarter campaign there are no plans for any changes regarding this matter. Although that is not to say future expansions will adhere to this ethos.
 Alternative Languages Rules:  Currently we have a Spanish fan made rulebook. At his time I am open to establishing French & German fan based rulebooks at this stage. These will be community based rulebooks. Dependent on demand we may seek professional translation to be available with the games commercial release. 
COMMUNITY TRANSLATIONS
 ITALIAN: A small group of Italian backers have started working on translation of the rulebook. If you're keen on helping out, head over to the BGG forum: ITALIAN TRANSLATION
   FRENCH: It looks like there may be a solution for a French translation in the near future but in the mean time, French fans, can we get a forum going for this?  FRENCH TRANSLATION
   GERMAN: A small group of German backers have started working on translation of the rulebook. If you're keen on helping out, head over to the BGG forum: GERMAN TRANSLATION
  FAQ - Pledging:
 Late Pledges: We will be partnering with Gamefound to assist with late Pledges, note that Late/Pledges & pre-orders will NOT have subsided shipping included. By backing at any level you will qualify for Free/subsided shipping should you choose to upgrade your pledge during the pledge manager.
 Stretch Goals: All Stretch goals unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign will be included FREE of charge in every copy of The Ratcatcher. Also where applicable, stretch goals will also be added to the Print and Play pledge level.  
 Multiple copies of the game: There are two options for the purchase of multiple copies, either by pledging at any level a backer will have access to the post campaign Pledge Manager (Gamefound.com), this will allow the backer to add additional copies of the game, shipping will be calculated & charged as a bundle (so you should save a bit of money). Alternatively if you have a few fellow gamers there is the Horde pledge, which will give you a discount as well as discount shipping. Just because it's a solo game dosen't mean we can be social ;) 
FAQ - Shipping:
 What is Subsidised shipping?: This is me covering a portion of the total shipping costs. Platypus Industries will pay $10 AUD of the total shipping cost. This is a little thank you for supporting us during the Kickstarter campaign. 
 Shipping black zones: Sadly as much as it pains us to to say. There are certain locations around the world that we will NOT be able to deliver our product. We are sorry if this causes any inconvenience, but we encourage all affected to contact their local FLGS as they may find Distribution/alternative routes to obtain copies.

Risks and challenges
World economics: firstly, we are not economists. Global economics are alway fluctuating and global event particularly around the global pandemic are making it extremely difficult to predict the condition of the market short or long term. We are well aware of this and will endeavour to work through and communicate any events or situations that effect the delivery of this game. 

Manufacturing: Communication and detailed specification have been provided to a handful of manufacturers as to get a comprehensive quote and product outline. Discussion regarding samples and proofing are already underway. We are confident moving forward into the manufacturing process for this product. 

Shipping/fulfilment: One of the most unpredictable facets of Kickstarter delivery. We will endeavour to keep everything manageable but there are plenty of elements that will be out of our control. Local & international Taxes/tariffs, freight, local currency exchange, misc costs. 
We have budgeted some safety funds in the funding goal to mitigate unexpected changes to our costs with regards fulfilment of the product.

Art & Graphics: Artwork/graphic design for the game is completed. If additional artwork is required is all done by the resident artist so there will not be any delays with any required artwork. 

Game Design & Development: the core game is locked in, but as with any crowd funding campaigns, with so many eyes on the design I’m sure there will be some great ideas and insight into the design that may need to be implemented. We will endeavour to put things in place without delaying any of the current delivery timelines.

*** FULLY FUNDED DAY 1!  FINAL DAY! 8 STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED! ONLY 29 BACKERS AWAY FROM THE NEXT STRETCH GOAL! ***
After burying her only daughter, the deadliest bounty hunter in the galaxy discovers her next job will jeopardize the only thing She has left... her secrets.  


SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known is a brutal, action-packed sci-fi graphic novella from award-winning writer Ryan K Lindsay (Eternal, Chum) and illustrator Chris Panda.
Who Will Love SHE?
Fans of action packed, heart-infused, high-concept sci-fi like EAST OF WEST, BLACK SCIENCE and SAGA.
Collectors of glorious, original, and sexy-as-hell hardcover graphic novels.
Process junkies who will love taking a deep dive into the creative process with Lindsay & Panda's delicious back-matter.
What Exactly Do You Get When You Travel to the Tower of All That is Known in This Campaign?
 SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known is a 64-page OVER-SIZED FORMAT hardcover graphic novella, featuring a special DIE-CUT translucent helmet cover, sure to be unlike anything you've seen in the galaxy.
All backers $7+ will receive loads of bonus content, including an original SHE theme by George O'Connor, digital deluxe process pieces taking you deep into the SHE universe.
Higher pledge levels will have access to campaign exclusive collectibles and merchandise, included enamel pins, custom toys and much more!
And for serious fans of the standard single-issue comic format, we'll be making a special limited edition variant of SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known available. This will be a 48-page, staple-bound comic with a metallic foil cover by Chris Panda, with a special homage to the classic THE UNCANNY X-MEN #141 "Days of Future Past" cover by John Byrne.
This special foil edition variant is included in the Collector's Box and will be limited to 100 copies! 
Back With Confidence, As Ryan K Lindsay & ComixTribe Have a Perfect Track Record for Delivering on Kickstarter!
 Here's what fans of Ryan's work have been saying:
 In these uncertain times, there is one thing that you CAN count on... it's that Ryan, Chris & the team at ComixTribe will deliver one helluva a comic into your hands!  
AND HERE'S THE EARLY COMIC INDUSTRY BUZZ ON SHE...
Ryan K Lindsay writes comics.
He has partnered with artist Eric Zawadzki to produce: ETERNAL through Black Mask Studios, and HEADSPACE, with Sebastian Piriz, through Monkeybrain Comics/IDW.
He has partnered with artist Sami Kivela to produce: BEAUTIFUL CANVAS through Black Mask Studios, DEER EDITOR through his own ‘Four Colour Ray Gun’ imprint and a handful of Kickstarter successes,  and CHUM through ComixTribe.
He was selected as a participant in the DC Writing Workshop group of 2016.
His other comics include: Aurealis and Ledger Award winning NEGATIVE SPACE with Owen Gieni through Dark Horse Comics,  GLOVES with Tommy Lee Edwards in the Vertigo CMYK anthology, as well as EIR with Alfie Gallagher, INK ISLAND with Craig Bruyn, and STAIN THE SEAS SCARLET with Alex Cormack through Kickstarter for ‘Four Colour Ray Gun.’
He’s written/edited analytical texts, including THE DEVIL IS IN THE DETAILS: EXAMINING MATT MURDOCK AND DAREDEVIL through Sequart, and has had essays published in Criminal, Godzilla, Sheltered, Strange Nation, and Crime Factory.
He is Australian and when not being a family man he hones his writing skills by sacrificing blood wombats to the outback spider fight clubs.
Chris Panda is a French illustrator and comic artist living in Berlin.
He's been working as an illustrator since 6 years and decided to move to the comic book world 4 years ago.
He mainly have worked as an interior and cover artist with american publisher IDW on title like MICRONAUTS, ROM, STAR TREK vs. TRANSFORMERS and TRANSFORMERS/GHOSTBUSTERS. And also had published his own comic book WONDERLAND RESISTANCE via Kickstarter.
If you’ve been following Ryan K Lindsay’s career over the past decade, you know that he likes to dig into the emotional core of big genre stories and is passionate about making creator owned comics.
You also probably know Ryan has a keen eye for talent, and in Chris Panda has found the perfect partner to bring this action packed sci-fi, intergalactic espionage tale that doesn’t shy away from big ideas & emotions to life.
Here at ComixTribe, we’ve built a reputation for producing some of the slickest hardcovers in the world of comics… but we’re not content to rest on our laurels.
And that’s why we decided to partner with Sam Amborn at Printlore to do something truly special with this cover.
First, we decided Chris' big visuals needed more room, which is why this book is large format (7.75” x 11.25”) which is 30% bigger than your standard comic book!
Watch This to See How That Awesome Die-Cut Translucent Cover Works:
PLAY

We wanted to replicate the appeal of the visually stunning mask SHE wears by creating a special Die-Cut, transparent, layered image that will turn heads all across the galaxy.
Our goal is to create a stunning, original graphic novella package that’s beautiful inside and out! 
Creator owned comics live and die on the support of readers like you.

A Kickstarter launch lets us reach sci-fi comic fans around the globe and raise the substantial amount of funding we’ll need to fire up the press and create this one-of-a-kind hardcover, unlike anything you’ve seen before.
 Funds raised above and beyond our modest goal will go into project stretch goal enhancements for our backers as well as be invested back into the series.
 Want a Peek? Take a Look at These Pages Inside the Book... 
Want to See More Before You Ascend the Tower?
If you'd like to read even more of SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known before you back this campaign, we invite you to download this extended ashcan preview.
💀 CLICK HERE TO ACCESS THE EXTENDED ASHCAN PREVIEW 💀

The SHE team has been working on this project for well over a year. The book is done, our printer is already working on the finer details of our custom book, and we're ready to roll as soon as this baby funds! 
As usual for ComixTribe campaigns, US shipping is FREE… 
...but given that many of Ryan's fans are AUSSIE based and how rough the past few months have been due to wildfires, hailstorms, flooding and of course, viruses... 
...we’ve also decided to make AUS shipping free as well on most pledge levels!
 (Your welcome, mates!)
Here's How We Protect Your Rewards in Transit So Books Arrive in Great Condition for Collectors:
It's so not cool when you back an awesome Kickstarter campaign only to have your books damaged upon arrival, right?
To prevent that, we package our books with collectors in mind, and use Gemini Comic Mailers to protect and secure your books during transit.
And our Collector's Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.

Once this project funds, we’re going to get right to firing up the presses so we can get it on your shelves as soon as possible.
Please know that the entire creative team has been working on this for over a year, and we’re dedicated to ensuring all backers receive more than just a story, but an experience with SHE.
And if you love her as much as we do, there will be more SHE stories in the future.
 So if you’re a fan of action packed sci-fi, intergalactic espionage, and big ideas & emotions in your comics,  then scroll down our Kickstarter page, find the pledge level perfect for you and join us for the wild ride.
And after you back, please take the time to share the link somewhere you use your voice for good.
Click to Share on FB
Click to Share on Twitter
Tell the people you know that #SheIsComing and they are going to want to get on board!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The support of backers on Kickstarter has been instrumental to the success of ComixTribe since our very first project back in 2012 and Ryan K Lindsay, who has been launching projects since 2014. 

Our success would not have been possible without the support of thousands of backers like you over the years...

So you better believe we take the trust of our backers very seriously.

We've taken a number of actions to mitigate risk associated with this campaign, including completing the creation of the book prior to launching and establishing a strong relationship with a quality printer who has done great work for us in the past and known for a hands on attention to detail and quality craftsmanship.

Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks, unforeseen hiccups, and lessons learned...and we've certainly learned valuable lessons from every past campaign.

During this time of global uncertainty, we realize that steady communication with our backers throughout the campaign and fulfillment process is key... and should any unforeseen issues cause delays, our backers will be the first to know. We're all going to get through this! 

We're committed to delivering a superior reward delivery experience for our backers, so we're investing in the best protective shipping materials for comics and collectibles, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house, to eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition.

ComixTribe and the SHE team have a long track record of delivering the goods, and the fact that we enjoy so much support from returning backers is testament to that.

So we invite you to back with confidence, as we want to be entertaining you for years to come.

A group of young prodigies have been kidnapped from a national science fair. They must use their wits to overcome dangerous obstacles, carnivorous plants, and a relentless killer robot if they ever hope to escape from "The Scientists".
Movie Poster Variant!

The Creators
 Trent Becket and I began writing the script for the Scientists in 2005. Now, after fifteen years, I'm so excited to bring you the completed graphic novel, which I have finished in his memory.
I have successfully kickstarted the first three chapters. Now as I bring the conclusion of this story to life, I’m back with the biggest launch yet. Not only can you get the fourth and final chapter of the series, but I am also collecting it in a beautiful hardcover volume, so you can read it as one continuous story.
 See what people are saying about The Scientists! 
PLAY

The book is all drawn! It was a huge undertaking, but now that the hard part is done, help me get this into your hands: 
Full page board
 Want to read the first 32 pages for free?
 Stuart Chin and his fellow prodigies all travel to a national science fair at the mysterious pyramid shaped Hofzinser Institute.
 They are abducted and awaken to find themselves wearing hazmat suits lost in the maze-like corridors of the facility somewhere deep underground.
  They don't know the reasons for their kidnapping or who they can trust.
 They learn the threat is real and they're going to have to learn to work together if they hope to escape!
 The mysteries begin to deepen...
 Their fates are uncertain...
 They search for the way out. 
 Shocking discoveries are made...
 And they will have to risk everything!
  The Budget plan:
(designs not finalized)
 Want to add some extra stuff onto your reward? No problem! I have a lot of cool stuff  from past campaigns and it would be impractical to try and create a reward tier of every possible combination. Instead, if you want to add any of this stuff onto your pledge, you can just add the amount onto the pledged amount. If you already made your pledge, you can update it by clicking the "Manage my pledge" button. 
Thanks for checking out The Scientists!
Your support is what makes this whole thing possible. I am forever grateful to be able to share this story with you guys.
Join the experiment!

campaign.story:
SKYSCRAPER is a procedural crime story from Ryan K Lindsay and Mitchell Collins that weaves in elements of the weird putting it somewhere between THE BLACK MONDAY MURDERS, LOST, and PAPER GIRLS.
When the VP of KDP flies out the top floor and dives into the pavement out the front, there are a lot of questions to answer. Enter: Keene, an independent contractor brought in to help figure out how and why she died. What unfolds is a mystery spanning decades that becomes less about why one woman dies and more about why a building would conspire to make it happen.
This 24 page one-shot utilises a central conceit that can only work in comics - every single page is framed exactly the same way, it’s a front shot of the KDP building, but different panels and tiers of the page can jump around through time. Collins’ expressive and intricate inkwork delivers us characters and moments through zoomed panels and cutaway areas so each page jumps around in time to build a truly epic story.
This comic is nearly completely finished and ready to deliver.
NEWSPAPER SIZED PRINT STOCK
This comic is something special. The detail and care Collins put into every page needed more than the US standard sized comic could hold. You deserve to be able to spread this out and drink it in, so we’ve decided to print this as an extremely oversized edition. At over twice the size of a regular comic, this is more like a newspaper in your hands.
The nature of the size means the comic will be folded to be posted to you, but this isn’t a CGC affair anyway, this is the kind of thing you rattle with your hands with every read, the kind of thing you share with your mates, and the kind of thing that deserves to live.
We hope you agree.
DIGITAL OPTIONS
There is a digital option for this comic, if you want to take it in as a PDF, but you will naturally forego that size element that makes this something special - unless you read it on an iPad Pro, or perhaps an interactive tv screen. 
FIRST DAY BACKER PARTY
For those who back in the First 48 Hour Window, well, do I have some goods for you.
Early believers get their hands on some extra digital swag, where you'll be instantly linked to:
A PDF of BEAUTIFUL CANVAS #1 [art by Sami Kivela], and
2 PDFs of my short comics about a prison for supervillains and a guard with size manipulation powers, LITTLE MAN IN THE BIG HOUSE [art by Paul Tucker, and Francesco Iaquinta]

Now, you need to trust me, you want more Mitchell Collins art in your life!
Here are some examples of pin ups he's done.
STRETCH GOALS!
UNLOCKED! $6000 - You get a free pdf of STAIN THE SEAS SCARLET from me and Alex Cormack, as well as a pdf of my second D&D Adventure: ESCAPE FROM WEN KROY
UNLOCKED! $7000 - Mitchell Collins and I got busy straight after this comic, so we've been slinging a new pitch around, and you can see the pdf of this new book, TREE - it's like Veronica Mars meets John Constantine.
$8000 - You get a free pdf of FATHERHOOD, a one-shot I made with Daniel Schneider years ago, and, AND, I'll also include an "RKL Motivational Comics Quote" in every parcel on paper and in my awful handwriting!
$9000 - You get free pdfs of these two short comics: TO SQUID AND DIE IN LA with Boy Akkerman, and BEFORE THE CHERNOBYL JOB with Alfie Gallagher
$10,000 - If we double our total, I will include a print copy of INK ISLAND [my all ages one-shot with Craig Bruyn] in every single parcel. That's right, more paper in your parcel, more comics for your hands.
These are our exciting Stretch Goals, so we hope you are pumped to bring others in, share the link, talk about the project and what excites you about it, and hopefully we'll hit all of these goals.
CREATIVE TEAM
Ryan K Lindsay - I wrote this funk, and maybe you’ve read other books by me like the Kickstarter successes; DEER EDITOR, INK ISLAND, EIR, and/or STAIN THE SEAS SCARLET. I’ve also worked with Vertigo, Dark Horse, IDW, ComixTribe, and Black Mask to release comics like ETERNAL, NEGATIVE SPACE, BEAUTIFUL CANVAS, CHUM, and HEADSPACE.
Mitchell Collins - Mitch Collins is an Australian comic book artist. He loves to tell all sorts of stories, bringing pictures to the words. His credits include being part of Gestalt Comics TALGARD and featuring in the upcoming UNDAD VOL 3 and this comic here. He also works in storyboarding for short films, animations, UI & UX concepts. When MItch isn’t working, he usually enjoys a nice cold one and a cigar out by the pool.
Simon Robins - Simon's keen interest in comics was sparked by 2000AD as a young teen and has grown consistently since. He graduated from the Victorian College of the Arts with a Bachelor of Fine Arts majoring in photography where he created sequential photographic collages for his final porfolio and RMIT with a Masters of Design focusing on the visual communicative power of comics. Changing his career direction from design to comic book colouring, his career in comics started a little later than many. Simon draws on the skills and experienced gained from two decades working in the design and photographic industries to inspire his comic book colouring. Now a professional colourist he has worked with both mainstream and independent publishers/creators. Outside of comics he maintains sanity by screaming in a grindcore band, frequently cheats death on a mountain bike, is endlessly inspired by his wife and two daughters and takes solace in long walks on the beach with his slightly mad mutt Macey.
Simon--Ryan--Mitchell

KEEP SAFE N' GRILL ON 
Introducing our bristle-free grill scraper and stainless steel skewers! 
This grilling set was designed to make your grilling experience both more versatile, and safer. Classic wire bristle brushes can be dangerous to use. The bristles can easily break off the scraper, and get left behind on the grill. Ingestion of wire bristles can cause perforated esophagus or intestines, which are serious medical conditions and surprisingly common given the popularity of the wire bristle brush.
These bristles can cause damage while you eat, which isn’t a good mood setter for your summer cookout. 
 Set a good mood for your summer cookout! 
The Grrrilla scraper takes away this possibility by providing the same capabilities as your traditional scraper, in a compact size with a strong solid body of stainless steel as opposed to bristles.
How do you clean a grill brush? You don't. Gross. Until Now!
Clean Grrrilla in the dishwasher!
Simply remove the leather cord and put it in the dishwasher!
------------------------------------
FEATURES
Our Grrrilla design is unique to us, as is its versatility. This scraper is compatible with almost any model of charcoal, propane (gas), and campground grills. 
The Grrrilla’s compact size creates a lower risk for any breaking or chipping, while still leaving realistic space for usage of the product allows for easy storage while still being easy to use. 
It also functions as a bottle opener! 
An extra way to ensure you have the tools you need for your cookout.  
For those who like to grill by lakes, or who simply like to take their portable grills out of the backyard once in a while, this tool provides a compact way to make sure every grill you use is clean. Compatible with most grills and able to fit in your pocket or picnic bag, this tool is designed for the adventurous griller as well as the everyday one.
We are launching a unique set of stainless steel skewers as well!    
To make sure you really have everything you need, we have made companion skewers to our Grrrilla. Our laser cut stainless steel designs create durable products that can be used repeatedly without fear of quick wear or bending. The skewers are 9-inches long and made to fit any of your kebab needs.
-------------------------------
SPECS
While the durability and function found in these tools are important to us, so are the people who make them. All of our production work on this project is, as always, completely within the USA. Our skewers even celebrate this with an American flag laser cut into the top of each one. So throw them on the grill, and get a couple burgers going to celebrate with us! Open a bottle, enjoy yourself, and after it all you can ensure you have a safe and clean grill with your new Grrrilla tool.
-------------------------
REWARDS
Want even more scrapers or skewers? 
See our FAQ section on how to pledge for more options that we could have imagined ourselves! Go wild, get in on these before summer starts!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with all design projects there are risks and challenges. Good news though, you are funding a team that has already produced and successfully delivered a bunch of other Kickstarter projects! We have been working together for over a year now and already work with our vendors and deal with fulfillment on a daily basis.

That said, we know very well what things can go wrong. In setting up a new manufacturing line, there are risks that the first sample doesn't meet the design specifications and requires retooling. Finish on the final parts, once produced in larger batches, can also be an issue that requires additional post-treatment. Finally, vendors - in our experience - are not always able to stick to their time estimates.

We have added buffer into our delivery estimates to deal with unexpected issues that are sure to arise. The manufacturing line is 95% complete, we are most of the way there.

campaign.story:
Introducing The Misen Nonstick Pan 
The Misen Nonstick Pan is, in our humble opinion, the best value in nonstick. It performs better than nonstick pans that cost over $130, at a fraction of the price. No gimmicks. No BS marketing claims. Just premium, long-lasting performance at an honest price. 
We love nonstick pans for cooking eggs and delicate foods, but they have always been a frustrating purchase for us. Because the truth is that ALL nonstick pans eventually stop working and start sticking when the coating wears off. There’s no magic fix for this.
People basically have two options: buy cheap nonstick pans that may last a few months or years at most, or expensive ones that may last a bit longer, but will still need to be replaced. Both options seemed pretty bad. So we decided to create something better.
Our goal was simple. Create an insanely long-lasting and durable nonstick pan, and sell it for a price that’s fair and affordable. We think we nailed it.
So how is it that we can make a nonstick pan that performs better than expensive ones which cost well over $100, and sell it for a fraction of that price? Simple. By cutting out traditional retail middlemen and selling directly to you online, we’re able to offer incredible quality, at wholesale pricing 
People often ask how long nonstick pans last, and the true answer is "it depends." The lifespan of a nonstick pan is not just related to the quality of the nonstick coating, but also to how frequently it's used and how it's cared for. 
What IS much clearer, is knowing when you need to replace your nonstick pan. Scratches. Sticking. Flakes. Hotspots. If your nonstick pan has any of these, it's time for an upgrade. 
Bad Nonstick! Bad!
The Misen Nonstick System is made of two key parts: an industry leading, PFOA-Free Nonstick Coating, and an innovative Plasma Primer. Both elements work together to form a Nonstick System that is absurdly durable, and provides long-lasting performance.
A good analogy for how nonstick coatings are applied is painting a wall. While the quality of the paint/coating and number of layers used matters, so too does does the primer, or how the wall/pan is prepared for accepting the paint/coating. This primer layer is a crucial and often overlooked element in making great nonstick. 
Rather than using a traditional 'grit blasting' primer method, for the Misen Pan we decided to use an innovative Plasma Primer. Infused with Titanium, the Plasma Primer Layer is 2.5 times more effective than the traditional primers, and extends the hardness and abrasion resistance of nonstick coatings.
Plasma Primer: How We Tested
Admittedly, we were skeptical when we heard about the very buzzword-y "Plasma Primer." There are so many BS nonstick claims ("it'll last forever!") and infomercials, and we thought the Plasma Primer might be another gimmick. But after research, it seemed the the Plasma Primer was legit, and we wanted to test it out.
With the help of a low-profile shaking machine, we performed a series of forced abrasion tests meant to simulate long-term wear. We tested the Misen Nonstick Pan against many other nonstick pans without a Plasma Primer: Cheap Pans, Expensive Pans, and even Ceramic Pans. The Misen Nonstick Pan outperformed all of them.
Forced abrasion testing to simulate long-term wear
In forced abrasion testing, the Misen pan showed considerably less wear than other pans
In addition to the Plasma Primer, the second and equally important part of the Misen Nonstick System is...the nonstick coating itself! To again use a painting analogy, the quality of the paint/coating itself, and the number of coats/layers applied affect performance.
For our pan, we use Dupont's premier 3-Layer Platinum coating, modified to work even better with our Plasma Primer. This PFOA-Free coating is Dupont's most scratch and abrasion resistant nonstick finish, and is even designed to withstand normal metal utensils and abrasive scouring pads.
(this was really fun)
We know safety is a major concern with nonstick pans, and dislike how many brands omit information about their nonstick, like what coating they use. We want you to be as informed as possible about the tools you're using to cook for yourself, your family, and your friends. To answer a common question of "is nonstick safe?", the short answer is yes. PTFE cookware is safe to cook with, but you should avoid very high temperatures. For more information and specifics, check out our FAQ.
For the base of our nonstick pan we used a 4.2 millimeter thick, commercial-grade aluminum construction. This thick base ensures a flat, even cooking surface for the life of your pan, and helps provide amazing heat distribution for better cooked foods.
On the bottom of our pan, we bonded a stainless steel plate to ensure it's compatible with any heat source. Gas, induction, electric - they all work. 
4.2MM thick aluminum base provides even heat distribution
A Quick Rant! Many brands claim their nonstick pans are 100% dishwasher safe, and that you can use metal utensils on them. This is terrible advice! While doing either once in a while won't kill your pan, over time they wear your nonstick pan down faster. Don't do it!
It’s important your pan feels comfortable and balanced while in use. The Misen Nonstick Pan has a cast stainless steel handle, riveted to the base for a strong, reliable connection that will last. The pan also features a removable stay-cool silicone grip with a textured underside for incredible comfort and control.
Pan heats up. Handle stays cool.
The design process will always be at the heart of Misen. Lovingly obsessing over every single consideration of a product is pure joy for us, and it was no different this time around. After countless sketches, prototypes, testing, and an unholy amount of eggs cooked (the smell...), we knew we had a nonstick pan that was truly special. 
Cheesy Ending :)

This is our third Kickstarter Campaign, and with each successive project we've launched, we've made a point to be farther along in development and ready for production. All of our product tooling is finished, and we're ready (and excited) to start production.

While we can't control when these events happen, we can and will promise to communicate transparently and frequently with you. That's part of the fun of being a part of Kickstarter campaign, and it's what you deserve!

campaign.story:
Meet Hunter Murphy.  

Yesterday, he died of a drug overdose in a filthy New York City back-alley. Today, he awoke in the City Morgue with no real memory of who he is or how he got there. He only knows his name thanks to the toe tag he’s wearing. 
Slipping out into the night, Hunter wanders the city, clad in clothing he gathered from a dumpster. He may not know anything about himself, but he instinctively knows every corner of the teeming metropolis. 
And the city seems to know him.
Traffic flow seems to naturally break when he wants to cross the street. No door is locked to him, no metal gate sealed shut. When he runs into trouble (which happens quite a bit) the city seems to help him in some way.
But there are others who know him, too, or at least they think they do.
The Wide-Eyed Three is a group of conspiracy theory nutjobs who have been exiled from society—for good reason. When they learn of Hunter’s miraculous return from the dead, they think they’ve found their ticket to redemption. And if they have to kill Hunter again and again to prove their wild theories, that’s what they’ll do!
Hunter’s not a bad guy, but he has a secret.
And that secret is a killer.
METRO is a 122-page (very) dark urban fantasy graphic novel. Set in New York City, this is a violent, chaotic story with good amounts of mayhem, carnage, and humor. It is also a story of magic and wonder, exploring the nature of the sprawling cities we call our homes. As Hunter awakens into the hidden and unfamiliar world that exists alongside our owns, he learns what it means to be a normal human… starting with the idea that there is no such thing as normal.
The cover for METRO will be drawn by the the amazing Francesco Francavilla! 
    
Brian Quinn ( Co-Writer and Creator) is one of the stars of the TruTV televison series IMPRACTICAL JOKERS and one of the hosts of the hit podcast TELL 'EM STEVE-DAVE.
Cullen Bunn (Co-Writer and Creator) is the writer of comic books such as THE SIXTH GUN, HARROW COUNTY, UNCANNY X-MEN, and DEADPOOL KILLS THE MARVEL UNIVERSE.  
Walt Flanagan (Artist and Creator) is one of the stars of the AMC television series COMIC BOOK MEN and one of the hosts of the hit podcast TELL ‘EM STEVE-DAVE. He is also the artist of series such as BATMAN: The WIDENING GYRE.  
Philip R. Williams Jr. (Inker) is also known as Phill Will. He got his love of comics and art from his father and grandfather. Working on many indie titles, Phill is excited for readers to see his work.  
Wayne Jansen (Colorist) is a digital painter with a background in traditional materials and techniques.  
Marie Enger (Letterer) Marie Enger is a catch-all comic artist whose previous work can be seen in PISTOLWHIP, 2 SISTERS, ADVENTURE TIME, TABLE TITANS, and WE ARE IN A DARK PLACE. She colors comics, too, but she only wears black.
We have been developing this first METRO story for some time now. Along the way, we have talked to numerous publishers about the project. As we drew ever-closer to finishing the book, though, we realized that the right approach for a book like this was to publish it ourselves. By releasing this book on our own, we maintain complete control of the content, and this is a book that pulls no punches and, frankly, scared the Hell out of some of the editors we talked to. 
Now, we can bring you this story exactly the way we wanted to--in all its messed-up glory. 
Kickstarter allows us to create comic books for the joy of creating graphic novels and give our backers and supporters something unique and exciting. We love that a Kickstarter campaign lets us communicate and interact with our readers along the way. 
All interior artwork for METRO is complete, and the graphic novel is going through final lettering and design. This graphic novel tells a complete tale, while introducing a vivid mythology and world ripe for exploration. Brian, Walt, and Cullen have already started working on a new graphic novel set in the world of METRO. This campaign will help us judge if there is interest in the next book!
Proceeds from this campaign will go toward creative costs and printing. 
 We're keeping the reward levels fairly simple on this campaign. We are releasing a digital version of METRO ($10), a trade paperback version ($25), and a limited edition hardcover version ($50). If you just want to show a little support for the project, you can pledge at the $1 or $5 levels. We also have a few special reward levels, some featuring original art pages from the book or mystery boxes full of Cullen's comics! We haven't forgotten retailers who might want to support the book! We have a reward level to help you stock your shelves with Metro!
 $40,000 - Signed Bookplate - UNLOCKED!
When we reach this stretch goal, all trade paperback and hardcover copies of the book will come with a bookplate SIGNED by Brian Quinn, Walt Flanagan, and Cullen Bunn. 
$55,000 - Print Set - UNLOCKED!
When we reach this stretch goal, all trade paperback and hardcover copies of the book will come with a set of 4 Metro-themed prints by Walt and other surprise artists!
$75,000 - Official Metro Handbook - UNLOCKED!
When we reach this stretch goal, we will add "Official Handbook to the Metro Universe" entries to the PDF, trade paperback, and hardcover editions of the book!
$100,000 - Campaign Exclusive Podcast - UNLOCKED!
When we reach this stretch goal, Brian, Walt, and Cullen will record a special podcast that will be made available to everyone who pledged at the $10 reward level and above. 
$125,000 - Graphic Novel Foreword
When we reach this stretch goal, Cullen will write a foreword that will be added to the graphic novel. 
$140,000 - Graphic Novel Afterword
When we reach this stretch goal, Brian will write a afterword that will be added to the graphic novel.
$155,000 - Additional Prints
When we reach this stretch goal, we will add three more prints to the Metro print set!
 We have more exciting Add-Ons that will be unveiled as the campaign progresses!

Risks and challenges
When it comes to producing this comic, I've done quite a bit of research about comics on Kickstarter. Brian and Walt have run several successful campaigns, and we have partnered with experts in book production and deliver. 

Brian, Walt, and I did not want to launch this Kickstarter until the vast majority of the work was done. I'm happy to report that ALL of the artwork for this graphic novel is completed, and the book is being lettered as this campaign runs. 

This means that we will be delivering this book very quickly. Digital versions of the book will deliver to backers almost as soon as the campaign funds (we'll need just a little time to finalize the "Thank You" page), and the book will be sent to the printer for hard copy production immediately. 

Our primary goal is getting this book into the hands of our readers, so we're focusing on that! We have a team ready to manage the logistics of shipping the books out as soon as they are ready to go!

We're teaming with one of the biggest and best crowdfunding companies in the industry: BackerKit. Through BackerKit we'll easily be able to manage add-ons, surveys, address changes, and fulfillment.

--Cullen

updates.update_content:
Hey, folks! I wanted to give you a heads up on a new project!

BEYOND MORTAL #1, a 64-page comic of superheroes and cosmic horror, is now live on  Kickstarter!

This is an important book for me, one I’ve been trying to get together for a long, long time. Artist Danny Luckert and I have been working toward this moment since 2017, and I’ve been trying to make it happen since long before that. It’s a superhero/horror comic. We’ve created our own superhero universe and our own set of heroes. We’ve also created a pantheon of elder gods set on claiming that universe as their own. 

Think of it as the Avengers or JLA versus Cthulhu. 

The first issue is a giant-sized whopper at 64 pages! And we’re following it up with two more issues. But we don’t want to stop there. We have numerous tales to tell in this world. We see it as becoming a massive shared universe.

Hey, folks! I wanted to pop in real quick and tell you about a new Kickstarter project that will be launching soon! BEYOND MORTAL #1 is a 64+ page story of superheroes and cosmic horror from Danny Luckert and myself. Imagine if the Avengers or the Justice League went toe-to-toe with the minions of the Cthulhu Mythos. That's the story of heroics, horror, and survival that we're telling here. We're introducing a new team of superheroes, a new pantheon of deities, and a new comic book world that we're very excited about. You can follow the campaign at the link below. We'll be launching officially in about a week!

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/cullenbunn/beyond-mortal-1-by-cullen-bunn-and-danny-luckert

Cover by Paul Davey!
Six months from now, detailed schematics anonymously uploaded to the Internet will describe, with absolute precision, how to build a faster-than-light engine for $200 in easily-available parts. Space travel will be instantly—and chaotically—democratized. The entire cosmos is suddenly within reach of all humankind, without organization, authority, or limitation.  
This comics anthology is about what happens next.
The concept for FTL, Y’all! was inspired by a 12-year-old RPG.net thread, which was in turn inspired by the work of Jerry Oltion. "FTL" is an acronym for Faster Than Light, commonly used in science fiction to describe the capabilities of warp drives.
With 25 stories and over 350 pages of comics, FTL, Y'all! is one of Iron Circus Comics' biggest anthologies ever. 
Iron Circus Comics Kickstarter projects are fulfilled by Blackbox, a fulfillment company from the folks behind Cards Against Humanity! That means international shipping costs for this project will be much lower than we've ever been able to offer before, by as much as 70%. Blackbox manages this by shipping individual orders from within other nations, reducing taxes and fees significantly.
Check out our backer levels and see our new low shipping fees for yourselves!

updates.update_content:
Hey, all. Spike here. Long time, no chat!
Don't get too excited, this is a quick, li'l, Kickstarter-mandated update.
This account was founded in 2009, the year Kickstarter launched, under the name "IronSpike." The name I used everywhere, so that was only natural.
However, in the last 12 years? It's grown into something far beyond just me. Iron Circus Comics, formerly just a glorified self-publishing DBA, has grown into a small-mid graphic novel publishing house, the largest of its kind in Chicago, possibly the entire Midwest.

Hello, folks! Been getting a few questions about the books and when people can expect to receive them, and I thought it would be best to answer them in a update.
If you have't received a confirmation of shipping, nothing's been shipped! Unless BlackBox has recently and inexplicably changed their policy, anyway.
Also, unfortunately, it's worth noting shipping gets pretty heavy in December for everyone. 
BUT! I did recently receive a message that BlackBox plans on being finished with FTL Y'all's shipping withing TEN BUSINESS DAYS.

Heya, folks! "FTL, Y'all!" is in the US, and at our fulfillment warehouses right now! Start keeping an eye on your mailboxes for your physical rewards. 
Thanks again for your patience with this project! We hope you did the final product as much as we do.

Hello, everyone!
Have you filled out your BackerKit and received your PDF?
( And hey, is your address in the Backerkit survey current? You can still change it! You’ll be able to continue to change it for some time yet!)
And are you just waiting for the physical books to arrive? Well, good news!

Hello again, everybody!
As we’ve been saying, the primary hold-up for the project has been interfacing with Backerkit. But all that’s been cleared up, and if we haven't already, we will soon launch a “smoke test.” A small percentage of this project’s backers, about 50 people, will be receiving notices in their Kickstarter-associated emails to provide their information for fulfillment. If they ordered PDFs, they’ll also receive that! Digital fulfillment will initiate upon completion of the Backerkit survey, although it may take a few hours for the PDF(s) to be received.

Heya, folks, Spike here! Sorry for the lag on updating, but I've been in New Orleans for the American Library Association Annual Conference!
With the KS over, I just wanna thank everyone who backed for helping me secure a $30 PER PAGE PAGE RATE INCREASE for FTL's creators! That is NOT insignificant, and it's exactly why I continue to run Kickstarters for my anthology projects; these presales event make sure everyone involved walks away with more for their time and effort.

RE-FRIED Comics is a 48-page, saddle-stitch comic book collecting the best of our webcomics.
Working improv-style, we took old, public domain comics and gave them new balloons to create an all-new story. 
Going one page at a time (never looking ahead), we figured out the story based on the artwork alone. Once we established something, we couldn't invalidate it. Our only rule was, "Yes, and..."
The result is something like this:

FRIED Comics is a proud purveyor of offbeat, irreverent pulp fiction since 2013, and a labor of love for Clay Adams and Alexandre O. Philippe.
Our titles range from P.B.O.W. (PREGNANT BITCHES OF WAR), DEADSKINS!, RED XMAS, and RE-FRIED COMICS. Our comics are available on Webtoons, Tapas, comiXology, Amazon, and Gumroad. 
Clay Adams is a writer and filmmaker who's funded three projects on Kickstarter with FRIED Comics. His directorial debut, THE BOY SCOUT, was nominated for Best Short at the Golden Egg Film Festival in Los Angeles, and his feature script, THE ECLIPSE, placed second in the horror category of the FADEIn Awards. campaign.story:
Digitopia is a dystopian action adventure about a father trying to get his daughter to safety from a world that has collapsed on itself.  
Digitopia 1.0
What's in Digitopia 1.0?
Digitopia is more than just a high paced action story, the comic examines some of the big issues of our time, how minorities are treated, the roles shady governments and the media plays in our perceptions of reality.  
If you like your action adventure with a twist of social commentary you're going to love Digitopia. 
Project UPDATE #1 (Updated 06/05/18): Our first stretch goal UNLOCKED!!
Not only has Digitopia 1.0 has reached its initial target - but the first stretch goal of the campaign has now been UNLOCKED! A massive thanks to everyone who helped push us over this milestone!
What does this mean for you?
Now that we have hit our first stretch goal of £1,300 - we are excited to now employ comic book writer and editor Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou as guest editor on Issue #1. Hass was recently nominated for an Eisner Award (that's the Oscars of comics if you didn't know) for his outstanding work on PanelxPanel (https://gumroad.com/panelxpanel) and is also well known for his insightful and in-depth Strip Panel Naked YouTube channel.
But wait...there's more! EVERY BACKER will also get digital copies of 'Oxymoron' issue #1 and 'The Red Ten' issue #1- that'll be three comics delivered to your inbox.
Hassan is now guest editor on Digitipia 1.0
Plus you'll get digital copies of 'Oxymoron' and 'The Red Ten' delivered to your inbox.
Project UPDATE #2: New Rewards available - GOING FAST!
All the Your Likeness as a character rewards in the comic were taken in the first few days of running - we've had so many request to have more likeness awards in the comic that we've introduced these new ones.  
You as a Renegade Biker
Jay is being hunted down by a vicious biker gang in Digitopia 1.0.  As Jay tries to evade them these two renegades give chase - this is your chance to have your likeness as one of these renegade bikers.
Be one of the Renegade Bikers - THESE REWARDS HAVE BEEN TAKEN
Your likeness as the Giant Biker Gatekeeper
Between Jay and escape from the biker gang is the Giant Biker Gatekeeper - will the giant let Jay escape?
This is your chance to be drawn as the Giant Biker Gatekeeper. 
Be the Giant Biker Gatekeeper - THIS REWARD HAS BEEN TAKEN
Your likeness as the Producer of New Digitopia Radio Freedom
The airwaves of what is and what isn't told is ruled by New Digitopia Radio Freedom.  This is your chance to be drawn as the producer of this radio station. 
What isn't broadcast is as powerful as what is - THIS REWARD HAS BEEN TAKEN.
The Star born into Digitopia - Libra
Immortalise your daughter, granddaughter or your child self in the pages of our comic book. 
Have their likeness drawn as integral character Libra, our main protagonist Jay's daughter. 
As she features throughout all four issues of Digitopia this is a rare and valuable reward
Note for all of the likeness awards you will need to supply at least 4 photos so Seb can accurately capture the likeness for the comic book.  
Who are the team behind Digitopia?
Farhan Qureshi, that's me, I'm a writer and filmmaker from London, I've worked on many projects in roles ranging from writer to director, VFX lead to producer.  
Hey I'm Farhan, I'm the writer of Digitopia
Projects I've worked in include three Harry Potter movies, Batman Begins, Pirates, Poseidon, Riddick as well as Alien and Predator movies. I was one of the Lead Artists for the London 2012 Olympic Ceremonies as well as the Xbox One launch.  
I love writing high octane action adventure stories which have deep human messages at their core.

campaign.story:
Hello, and welcome to The Patrons Kickstarter Campaign! The Patrons is a neo-noir sci-fi comic book series. Set in Shepherd's Rest, a mega-city on the edge of an endless wasteland. With crime, corruption, and a brewing revolution, the world is balancing on a knife-edge. It's up to a lone soldier to decide which way it will fall.
The goal of this Kickstarter is to raise funds for issue #1 of The Patrons - 23 full color, masterfully illustrated pages (NOW 48 PAGES BECAUSE OF STRETCH GOALS). There will be three versions of issue #1. STANDARD, VARIANT, and NOIR. Variant and noir editions are unique to kickstarter and will not be available elsewhere. Any additional funds raised will go directly toward the production of further issues of the series. 
The Patrons is illustrated by Gary Inloes and written by William Johnson and Anthony Scott. Two years ago, we quit our full time jobs to make this dream real, and response online has been amazing. We’re super excited to bring the world of The Patrons to life, but we need your help. Below you can find a deeper description of the story, find comic page samples, rewards that we are offering, and more. If this is a project that you are interested in, please support our campaign and tell your friends about it.
Because of the support we've gotten from the Kickstarter community, we have the privilege to add stretch goals to our campaign.
After plague, famine, and civil warfare brought earth’s population to the brink of extinction, the Patrons provided salvation. They offered food, shelter, and technology to the survivors. All the world’s natives congregated to their city, and the earth began to flourish once again.
However, as society reformed, so did its sins. Crime and corruption was rampant in the city’s slums, so the Patrons constructed walls to keep the natives at bay. Allowing only citizens with a pure Patron bloodline to pass through their gates.
The Patrons tells the story of Elliott, a low-born Patron soldier, and a mysterious assassin who hunts him. Exposed to life on both sides of the wall, Elliott must learn to live with the violence of native crime lords and the sadistic nature of the Patron’s Ministry of Affairs.
But the further he gets pushed into a world of back-alley murders and political corruption, the more he questions which side he should be fighting for. After a leader of a cult resistance gives him a way to atone for his sins, Elliott must choose between loyalty to the Patrons, and the lives of the survivors of families that he destroyed.
PLAY

The Noir Editions is a black and white throwback to a time of great detective fiction of the 40s.
This isn't simply a black and white filter placed on the final images. Each panel is hand tailored to the aesthetic and includes voiceover from Elliott (the protagonist). The Noir edition will be a different experience and include additional insights into the story.
Niera the Snatcher, a "Supporting" tier character.
We love comic stores and are offering this special Kickstarter version of the book to retailers during the campaign. We treat retailer backers just like other backers in that they receive their rewards before the book is available anywhere else.
If you are a retailer, please email contact@thepatronsgn.com for more info.

Risks and challenges
This is our third project on Kickstarter. We haven't been mistake free, but each project's lessons have built upon the last. We are very confident that the risks in making our book are very low, and we will be able to deliver all rewards in a timely manner.

That being said, this Kickstarter is production and print, that's a big project. And the bigger the project, the more chance there is for things to go wrong. Our team will work around the clock to fix these issues, and as a backer we will always keep you in the loop as to what is going on.
