updates.update_content:
Hi everyone.

We are unfortunately still in a limbo with Gary swamped at work. However, he has been able to make progress in the exterior city shots, which have been keeping him up at night. That being said, we're still in a 'ready when it is ready' zone. Gary is just being stretched too thin at work.

Hey team,

Sorry for the lapse. We're off to a slow start this year, Gary has been swamped with work and hasn't had much time to dedicate to Echo Black. He's still pushing every chance he gets.

Hi everyone,
We are getting closer to send our baby off into the world and see if she floats, and along with that comes small little updates. First of which, we can finally shed our working title of The Patrons. It's what I wrote at the front of the workbook when I started writing the story, but we weren't able to settle on a more pleasing title - until earlier this year.

Hi everyone, Anthony here.

2020 has been a weird one folks. Remember when it was a legitimate concern that you couldn’t find toilet paper? So much has happened that it seems like years ago. I can’t wait for this boring dystopia to be over. We are still optimistic on finishing the book in 2020. The delivery of a digital edition of The Patrons in 2020 is still possible. However, with manufacturing done in Taiwan and China, the book will not be ship this year. We are doing our best, working on the book every day. Some days can only afford 30 minutes, but some days (weekends) 8+ hours. It isn’t ideal, there is still much to be done, but we have to keep food on the table and a roof over our heads.

Hidey-ho Neighborino,
We're still working, we haven't given up. No doubt, lots has happened in the last few months and has slowed us down, but we've made progress nonetheless. 
Still pushing, still doing all that we can.

Hey everyone!
Quick update for you all. We're still pounding away our free time into The Patrons. Thank you for being patient with us. Gary is working his hardest to pump out and finish pages and I'm still working on supplementing his workflow with 3D assets to be used as reference. v v Finished page 1 below. v v

Lucky #13.
Sorry for the delay, working in live television with large audiences... it's a strange time. Latex gloves, gallons of hand sanitizer, and no TP to be found... Anyway.
I have a small update for you all.  Gary was able to make some decent progress, but I don't have anything to show you. Next month I will have some new art for you from the comic. I previously said that I was working on 3D to help Gary with some more of the menial tasks for the comic and I thought I would share some progress.

Hello Friends, Backers, and Lurkers, and happy new year!
I have to start off, as I do much too often, and apologize as we will not be hitting our January shipment goal. Part One has been a complicated mess, but at the end of the day, we are still waiting on art. I’ve said it before, much of the issue is complete. But there are still parts that need polish and some parts that are still in the storyboarding phase. I can best summarize how the issue looks by showing you the first page.

Hey Team,
Three years ago, Gary, Will, and I tossed ideas around a table. Most of them were pretty bad, but one stood out. We spent the next year and a half trying to figure out what this world was and who these people were. We crafted a web of characters, intertwined with grit, espionage, neon, and backstabs. It was the birth of The Patrons.
I would like to explain how we found ourselves in a series of delays, and what we've done to stop them. The first mistake was over promising on stretch goals. We thought that since we raised twice as much capital, we could afford to offer twice as much book. It works on paper, but the larger your project, the more problems come up - and they will come up. Without any wrenches in our workflow, we turned four months of production into eight months of production.

Hello Backers!
Lettering is done! I've never drawn so many straight lines in my life. Special thanks to my Ames guide.
Since letters aren't done by hand anymore, it's a little difficult to find a workflow that compliments the digital tools available today. So I made up one for myself. Here's a breakdown of the process I used.

Welcome to the Kickstarter for Touching Evil Volume 2: The Phantom Limb! 
THE PITCH:
 For those new to this award-winning supernatural thriller, the premise is simple: there is a curse that grants its bearers immortality and the power to kill people with a mere touch of the hand...if the person is evil. Sounds great, except for one little catch: the souls you kill live on in a prison inside your head. As if that wasn't bad enough, what if the person you kill happens to be someone you care about? And what defines evil anyway?
In volume one we followed Ada Mansfield: a single mom and hard working attorney who stumbled upon the curse and had her whole life turned upside down as she learned who her friends and enemies were...the hard way.  Now in volume two she discovers there may be someone who can break the curse once and for all, but it comes at a price. Ada is tasked with doing terrible things for the greater good, and I can assure you NO ONE is safe in this second volume that is high on suspense and thrills.
(Hey, if you're brand new to the series and want to read issue one for free, click https://www.dropbox.com/s/spxjhtlo9xz1a2c/Touching%20Evil%201%20PDF%20Comixology.pdf?dl=0 )
One of seven covers from the issues!
THE BOOK!
It's what we're all here for, so let's talk details! The book is almost exactly the same specs as volume one: a beautiful hardcover with cover art by Tom Kelly, story and art by me with colors by Kanila Tripp, and clocking in around 240 pages! Here's a mock up of what it will look like:
Mock up of the book!
I'm thrilled to say that the foreword is written by actor Dan Fogler!!! (Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them and the upcoming sequel The Crimes of Grindelwald, Fanboys, Balls of Fury) And once again, I have been fortunate to lock in some AMAZING artists to contribute pinups for the back of the book!
There will once again be an epilogue not featured in the original issues, and a Thank You Section for anyone who pledges at the hardcover level or higher!
More art from The Phantom Limb!
REWARDS! I am so excited about these!
- THE BEARDO COMICS CHALLENGE COIN! Measuring 1.5,” it’s a special bonus to let people know you’re down with Beardo Comics. And if two people with the coin are at the same bar, one will challenge the other to present their coin! If they can’t, they buy the next round! If they CAN, the challenger’s buying!  
 - TAROT DECK! One of the main characters in Volume 2 uses a tarot deck, so I had to start drawing a LOT of tarot cards! It got to the point where I realized I was pretty close to making a full deck. So I did! It's 78 cards, 22 Major Arcana and 56 Minor cards, all drawn by me with excellent case art by Andrew Dimitt!
Mock up of the deck and some of the cards!
 - REMARQUED BOOKS! You can get an original color drawing on the inside front cover of your book by me, just one more way to make your pledge a special and unique collector's item!
Example of a remarqued book!
- COMMISSIONS! I will be doing a limited amount of custom commissions, check out a gallery of examples here: www.beardocomics.com/commissions
YOU CAN BE DRAWN INTO VOLUME THREE GETTING KILLED OR SPARED BY THE CURSE!
Back by popular demand, I'm offering five people the chance to be drawn into Volume THREE as one of the evil people who gets killed by the curse! But I'm ALSO adding a new twist: you can choose instead to be one of three people who does NOT get killed by the curse! Want to show the world how good or evil you are? Or maybe kill or spare a friend or loved one on the printed page? This pledge is rare and gets you a coveted spot in the series for all time, AND you get one page of the original art that features you! And I really use your likeness more than just a bit! I can't show you ALL of the people I drew for Vol 2 because it'd spoil things, but here are TWO people who pledged last time and a THIRD who has been a super backer since day one!
THERE'S EVEN A MEGA-PLEDGE WHERE YOU GET A TON OF STUFF I'VE DONE: "DAN DOUGHERTY'S WORK IS EVIL!"
And here's an example of the original piece you could get from Comfort and Adam at the COMFORT AND ADAM ARE EVIL! level!
Example of Comfort And Adam are Evil Level!
And here's two examples of the original piece you could get from Bianca at the BIANCA ROMAN-STUMPFF GRAB IS EVIL! level!
Examples of Bianca's original art!
STRETCH GOALS: Brace yourselves, extra bonus art and comics are coming!
And if we get through these...
UPDATED WITH MORE STUFF!
Here's the majority of the book to show how much is done (and even more than this is done at the time of this writing):
PLAY

 Here's some cover work and some of my favorite pages (note that some pages I've removed the lettering either to avoid spoilers or showcase art, but everything is lettered in real life):
 WHY KICKSTARTER?
Touching Evil has been a success due to the fans, and Kickstarter is the most recognized platform for people to pre-order what they want directly from the creator, and get cool exclusive bonuses that are geared towards them. The better the campaign does, the better your pledge becomes. Additionally, I've done my share of KS campaigns and the mechanics of it are very familiar to me, so putting together a Touching Evil campaign on KS feels right at home. You can even check out the previous campaign if you're new to the series to see how it started: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/522440557/touching-evil-the-hardcover-graphic-novel?ref=user_menu

Risks and challenges
The book is mostly finished, I didn't want to start this campaign until it was. I am done with 5 of the 7 issues, and am currently working on the remaining pages, which I have allotted time for both in the campaign schedule and my personal work schedule. I have my printer picked out and my costs accounted for in the budget. My team is at the ready for every facet of the post production, from making and printing the book to fulfilling the orders. And most importantly: I've done this before in the previous campaign (as well as other successful Kickstarters I've run or been a part of) and have learned and become more efficient in my business. 

Basically, unless a force of nature strikes me down, I got this. And if I WERE struck down? Then your book just got more valuable, right? (hahaha, please nature, don't strike me down!)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, evil-doers! Just sending a quick update to let you know that the Floppy Cop 2 Kickstarter campaign is in its final 24 hours! Thanks to everyone who has backed and shared we have hit goal AND two stretch goals, and we are closing in on a third! If you've been meaning to back or are curious about what this crazy comic is (it's very funny, but I am biased as I wrote it) you can check out the campaign here:
 linky link link!

Hello, evil-doers! I'm thrilled to finally be able to say that the Kickstarter for Floppy Cop 2 is LIVE!
 Go to the Floppy Cop 2 Kickstarter HERE! 
Named "Comic of the Year" by Economics in Comics (yeah, we can't believe that either), Floppy Cop is the MOST fun you will have with a comic in 2021, and isn't that what we need right now? In Volume Two, Floppy meets his most interesting villain yet - PRETZEL FACE! He's looking to level the playing field by making ALL of the body types the same, because when we're all the same there is no shame! And what's even crazier is that Floppy Cop suspects that this gluten-packed nemesis may be someone on his own police force!

Hello, evil-doers! I hope you're having a good 2021 so far, or at least as best as can be expected under the circumstances. It goes without saying that we all know 2020 was an insane and bizarre year which changed a lot of things, not the least of which is the way people are connecting with new comic offerings. Most conventions are postponed until late 2021 (which I'm cautiously optimistic will be safe enough to attempt), direct market distribution is still rethinking a lot of its strategy, and comic shops are getting incredibly creative and working extra hard to keep the experience enjoyable.

updates.update_content:
As of last Friday, I started making the first of three trips to the post office to mail off these gorgeous tarot decks! All of you who ordered one should have gotten a message from me to confirm your address. So far, of the 67 decks ordered I've received 44 responses from those, so if you haven't responded yet please do! 
For my people getting them, I'd love seeing any photos or video! Show them off, do a reading, whatever!
After more obstacles than an American Ninja Warrior course, we finally have tarot decks! Check out the video below to see all 78 cards!

Hello, fellow humans! What's new since we last talked?
I'm kidding of course. The new normal is pretty nuts. I hope you're staying safe and staying away from people as much as possible. For my part, we've been doing exactly that: working entirely from home now, only going out for essentials (and the occasional run, always completely avoiding other people). My town is actually requiring by law the use of masks in public if you are going into any establishment or any area where people congregate. And I'm glad they're doing it, we have to take this seriously if we want to get out of this situation. I'm all in.

Just a quick update to let you all know another large batch of rewards went out this morning as promised.  Trust me when I say I'm checking off all the backers as they're being sent out, so when I get to what I think is the end of the line I'll announce it and if anyone doesn't have theirs at that point please reach out.
Also might have some good news for the tarot deck as we may have found a factory that is virus free somewhere else that can match the price I needed. I'll keep you posted on that as well.

campaign.story:
When a family of hunters become entangled with the myths and legends of their native land, strange things are bound to happen.  
Such things were once only whispers, though Garai, this family's provider, has now proven them to be true - leaving him with little recourse in training with his son, Eshe.
A winter storm lays into the land, the first in ages, and everyone is paying the price. Crops are scarce, animals are dying, and ancient monsters are beginning to appear,hunting between the dying trees, looking for anyone foolish enough to be caught within the new darkened day.
As the arms of  this vicious winter wrap around Garai, he must come face to face with those who wronged him, and seek for dark truths amidst the tundra that he once called home.
This first issue of Garai's story will span 32 fully colored pages, printed on the best variety of paper for maximum enjoyment, and be delivered SOON - the entire book is ALREADY DRAWN and fit for print, so there will be very little wait for you to receive your copy!
My name is Lee Milewski and I've been self-publishing comics for the past few years. It's been a truly enjoyable and ever-evolving journey to share my stories with different readers across the globe.  
A few of the titles that I've written and illustrated (which have also been Kickstarted by this amazing community!) are 1939: A Noir Graphic Novel, Focus Shift: An all ages sci-fi comic, and the Hunter's Lore graphic novel series.
The Winter Year will be a continuation of my style of storytelling, spanning across several planned issues (and hopefully MUCH more!), and allowing myself to build a world out of this family of hunters and their journey through loss, monsters, and ultimately, revenge.
I'm VERY excited to share it all with you!
This project is built from the ground up to be a several issues-long series, which can become a timely and costly endeavor. I am reaching out to the Kickstarter community in the hopes of being able to devote my time, concentration, and creative energy on The Winter year; in turn, I will be bringing to life an exciting and thoughtful story that you can read. My budget works like this:
The best part is that this issue is completely DONE and ready to print!
These books promise to have an excellent quality to them when read. Their specs will be:  
6.5x10" 
Premium Quality Paper 
Saddle-stitched 
32 Full Colored Pages 
Matte Laminated, CARDSTOCK Covers
 Please keep in mind that all reward levels are stacked, so the higher you choose, the more rewards you will get. Below are a few of the pledge options available to backers:
Add-Ons are extra rewards that will be shipped alongside your original orders. For those who may want a COMMISSION from me, this is for you!
(Add the corresponding amount to your initial pledge and message me your option - also, Add-Ons can only be used starting at the $20 Reward tier) 
---
Thank you SO MUCH for checking out the campaign to my new series, The Winter Year, and I sincerely thank everyone for their continued support - Let's make this comic a reality!!
-Lee

campaign.story:
This Kickstarter is for the complete 104 page full colour comic mini-series by artist Eric Zawadkzi [THE DREGS and ETERNAL], Sebastian Piriz [DARK BEACH, ONCE UPON A TIME MACHINE 2] and writer Ryan K Lindsay [BEAUTIFUL CANVAS and the award-winning NEGATIVE SPACE] as a PDF/Digital Omnibus re-release.
This series was first released by Monkeybrain Comics in 2014 and available via ComiXology, though that partnership has now lapsed. The tpb collection is out through IDW, but the digital rights still belong to us so we thought we should repackage it into a newer, better, faster, stronger version for people who might want to find it in pixels and cannot.
As such, this isn't just the miniseries, but this is a wild and massive Digital Omnibus Edition that's going to collect a whole mess of other stuff. If you are a process junkie, or interested in more than just the story on the page, then this is most definitely for you!
This series was also the first collaboration of the team behind this year's huge graphic novella release from Black Mask Studios, ETERNAL. The book that got amazing reviews and showcased what this pair can do, so get into HEADSPACE and see where they both started.
“The concept is brilliant and executed with such skill that’ll you’ll barely find time to take a breath. The pacing is perfect and the world building is insane. It’s as good as first issues get, and it sows the seeds of an infinitely more interesting world to come. I can’t wait to see issue 2.”
—Zac Thompson at Bloody Disgusting gives us a 5/5 review
WHAT'S THE STORY?
HEADSPACE is about Shane Garretty, the sheriff of Carpenter Cove, who comes to realise his town is exceptionally weird, and may not exist in the reality he thought it did. *SPOILERS* the town is in the mind of a killer, and Shane has no idea how he got in, or how to get out.
But if he's in the mind of a killer, then perhaps he can create some positive change for the world.
Then, actually out in the real world, the killer with the town in his mind goes on the run.
What ensues is a wild ride that's like a Philip K Dick story if adapted by John Carpenter. The book might be about responsibility, and the choices we make, but it's also got dog-headed bartenders, spontaneous tidal waves, and a boat made out of dead bodies.
"Lindsay has created a world where anything can happen. He has asked and answered that age-old philosophical question, “what if God is crazy?””
—Brad Gischia at Bag&Bored gives a really thought provoking and well written review
WHAT EXTRAS WILL BE IN THE DIGITAL OMNIBUS?
We want to provide something here that's insanely special and helpful and wonderful and a Must Read experience. As such, you can find the following things in the Digital Omnibus:
All 8 issues - this was digital first, and each issue was a 12 page affair, with the whole story clocking in at 104 pages
All 9 covers - each issue had a cover, as did the TPB - you can have 'em all
All back matter - the OG issues all had this gorgeous back matter that we poured our hearts into, and I don't think it's cheating to only ever offer it again here - there were pin ups by some wildly creative and talented peeps we'll list below, and there were essays from our editor Dan Hill that will open your mind, and make your life better
All scripts - I will throw in all 8 scripts, because those might be fun to read :]
All annotations - I write annotations on the issues I publish, so we'll include those here, too - they are me diving into what we were trying to do, whether we did it or not, and why the rest of the creative team are mad geniuses
The Pitch Package - we'll also attach the original pitch package I took to ECCC 2013 and shoved into hands and you can see where we started, and where things ended - warning: not many people have seen these pages!
What else would you like to see in here? Drop me a line and we can see, perhaps.
Gorgeous Vic Malhotra pin up
STRETCH GOALS
Okay, we're very well funded and so here's where we give a little back [or a whole lot back]. So far the campaign has unlocked the following Stretch Goals, and you can find the download links in the Campaign Updates.
There are 2 comics and 3 ebooks, and one more of each coming soon when we hit $3k.
Chum #1 download
Blind Dates & Broken Hearts - a Daredevil Essay
Noirvember - an ebook of essays about noir
To Squid and Die in L.A. - a short comic
  Layers of Fidelity - an essay about Ultimate Wolverine VS Hulk
and now we're chasing:
DEER EDITOR #1 and THE JAM SESSIONS when we hit $3k
DEER EDITOR #1 - an antler noir comic
  The Jam Sessions - great chats with Dan Hill about things
THE PLEDGE LEVELS
We wanted to keep this simple, and we wanted to get people excited, so the main pledge level was an easy one to create.
$5 - HEADSPACE DIGITAL OMNIBUS EDITION
Yep, just $5 and you'll get the whole damn thing. The story, all the extras, all the pretty horses. It's good value, but it's also a beast of a file. It'll be well over 300 pages for you to enjoy.
Plus, this file will only be available through this campaign at this price.
$10 - LETTERED PIN UPS
I will letter one of the pin ups with a special line or caption and email the one-of-a-kind jpg for your eyes only.
These are usually weird, superfun, and a great way to get a piece of my writing just for you! This is also a great way to support us with a few extra coins because you respect how low we made the entry level price of the Digital Omnibus :]
$20 - AUDIO COMMENTARY PODCAST SERIES
I'll record a series of discussions about the book - from inception, through each issue, and how I feel about it now. It'll probably be 4 episodes, but we can see in the end what it runs, I'm setting a 4 ep minimum, but am happy to naturally go over :]
LISTEN TO RKL HERE, where I talk about BEAUTIFUL CANVAS, to get an idea of the madness you'll be unleashing!
$50 - CARPENTER COVER NOIR SKETCH by RKL
I will illustrate a weird and wonderful noir sketch of Carpenter Cove, which basically means any character/location I want, and I'll send you the art in the mail [postage included]
$75 - RKL ANNOTATED SCRIPTS x 3
I will print the script for HEADSPACE #1 and write in red pen thoughts, and border doodles as I watch tv, and hopefully some decent craft/process based introspection.
Considering how long ago I wrote this script, I'll be very interested to see my own thoughts on it.
$100 SEBASTIAN PIRIZ PIN UP, own choice x 6
Sebastian Piriz is such a damn good artist, and his pin ups rock, so I'm envious of everyone that gets in on this good stuff right here!
You can commission him here to draw up a character for you on an A4 sized sheet
$140 ERIC ZAWADZKI PIN UP, own choice x 6
Eric Zawadzki is a phenomenal artist and his original inked works are a thing of beauty. I should know, I bought a Daredevil piece that features Elektra, Bullseye, Kingpin, Gladiator, and Typhoid Mary, and it's one of my favourite things in my office.
You can commission him here to draw up a character for you on 11x17 paper
Eric's Fantomex commission that still makes me salivate
There are only 6 available, so strike on this offer fast.
$300 - ERIC ZAWADZKI FULL COLOUR COMIC COVER, & inks to you x 3
Eric's cover game is a thing of beauty - stunning, visceral, beautiful. He's a dynamic addition to any creative team and here you can commission his skills for a decent price and he'll illustrate and colour a cover for your own book.
ALSO, Eric will then send you the original art for you to keep.
A steal at this price, and there will only be 3, so make sure you don't sleep on this one. Here's some Eric cover art to get you thinking!
Still need convincing?!
“Headspace is one of those mind fuck comics."
—Samantha Roehrig at Comics Bastards gives us 5/5
THE CREATIVE TEAM
ERIC ZAWADZKI
Art Phenom. Illustrator on this year's ETERNAL, and last year's THE DREGS, both from Black Mask Studios. Canadian.
SEBASTIAN PIRIZ
Inked Pleasure. Illustrator of DARK BEACH, and featured in ONCE UPON A TIME MACHINE 2, and once did some of the finest Nick Fury work in a Holiday Special.
MARISSA LOUSIE
Colourist Maestro. She's worked her magic on a multitude of titles, including ESCAPE FROM NEW YORK at Boom, SPELL ON WHEELS at Dark Horse, and THE WILDS at Black Mask Studios.
DEE CUNNIFFE
Palette Pleaser. Has been crushing it on the colours lately for REDNECK at Skybound, RETRUN TO WHISPER at Vault Comics, and GRAVETRANCERS at Black Mask Studios.
DAN HILL
Editor Supreme. I take him on all my projects from BEAUTIFUL CANVAS at Black Mask Studios, to DEER EDITOR via Kickstarter, to METROPO with Magnus Aspli.
RYAN K LINDSAY
Word guy. I've written ETERNAL with Eric Zawadzki at Black Mask, as well as BEAUTIFUL CANVAS at Black Mask Studios, the award winning NEGATIVE SPACE at Dark Horse Comics, and was in the DC Talent Program Writers Workshops for 2016.
And the whole squad brought it together, we promise:
“Headspace has one of the most satisfying endings I’ve seen in years. Lindsay crafted an emotionally draining adventure through the mind of a killer that’s unlike anything you’ll see on the stands today. It’s huge in scope and earnest as all Hell.”
James Ferguson at Horror Talk gave us 5/5 review for our finale
Brian Level pin up is a winner
~~~IMPORTANT~~~
~~~~~FIRST DAY BACKER PARTY~~~~~
To say thank you to everyone who already follows me, and came into the campaign early, which helps spread the word, I want to thank you all and reward you all, so here's the deal: all first day backers will get downloads at the end of that day for:
THE GHOST ENGINE ogn download - by Eric Zawadzki and Danny Djeljosevic
~~~~~~~STRETCH GOALS~~~~~~~ 
If there's one thing I love, it's stretch goals.
Stretch Goals will be digital downloads and will release in direct messages, from me to you, throughout the campaign, and in selective tiers.
Stay tuned for their announcements in the coming days :]
10 PAGE PREVIEW
Here are the first 10 pages of the book. We hope you dig.
Opening sequence is pretty ace, right? Wondering if we can stick the landing?
“The whole HEADSPACE team deserves some accolades here for one of the best indie series we’ve seen in some time.”
- Ed Garrett at TM Stash gave us a glowing 10/10 review
And from there, good friends, well, anything can happen :] 
And if you've scrolled this far, enjoy some quotes of support from some of your favourite creators!
 And the original house ad we ran back in the day!

campaign.story:
Hey there,

My name is Dan Ekis, I make comic books.
For my day job I'm a freelance illustrator.

And in the past I made a 65-minute animated feature film.

But since I was a kid I've dreamed of publishing my own comic book.

With your help, that dream is about to become a reality!
Soul of the World Issue 1 is a full-color, 25+ page comic book.
It's the first of a four part series scheduled to be completed by Summer 2018.

And Issue 1 has already been drawn!

The book is being lettered by Marco Della Verde.

He's done projects for Image Comics, IDW Publishing, Comics Experience, and more.

We only need $2000 to letter, print, and ship everything out.

And in order to ensure we are able to print the books at high quality . . .
And deliver them in a timely fashion, we are only printing 150 hard copies.

This signed, limited edition comic book will not be available anywhere after this campaign.
And we've already had way over 100 people commit to pledging.
So if you want a hard copy get yours now!

Thank you so much for helping me make this lifelong dream of mine come true.
I love you,
Dan

campaign.story:
SOMETHING REAL is becoming a reality!
Now that we've reached our funding mark, it's time to shoot for some Stretch Goals! The first three are listed below:
Stretch Goal #1 - We'll be able to publish an additional FOUR pages of boogeyman pinup art in the back pages of our book only if we meet the $3000 funding goal! 
Stretch Goal #2 - Ian Miller will provide us with a unique piece that teams SOMETHING REAL with THE HOLSTERED HEATHEN! Physical backers will receive this piece as a poster if we reach $3500 in funding!
Stretch Goal #3 - The great Drew Moss (IDW, Oni Press, Dark Horse, Image) will produce a wicked boogeyman print for all physical backers if we manage to reach $4000 in funding!
A Quick Preview of SOMETHING REAL #1 
(Click this link for a DETAILED viewing of pages 1-5)
We hope that you enjoyed the first five pages of our boogeyman book! The entire team behind Something Real has put a whole bunch o' hard work into it. Here are some details about the full issue:
Page Count - 32 (28 pages of story + 4 cover pages)
Binding - Saddle Stitch (staples)
Size - Standard Comic (6.625" x 10.25")
Paper - Cover (80# gloss cover) / Interiors (60# uncoated text)
Something Real #1 (Covers A & B)
The COVERS for Issue #1
Cover A - Ian Miller (inks) & M. Wayne Miller (colors)
Cover B (Signed Variant Cover) - Ian Miller (inks & colors)
It is "SOMETHING REAL" and it will NOT be denied
Its kind is despised around the world. Feared by all, but mostly by children. These creatures have been around since the beginning of time, so it seems. Lurking in the darkness, perhaps from which they were born. Surely conceived in the darkest shadows of creation's first days. Whatever their origin may be, one thing is certain...
Something is always watching and it's most definitely real. Not all children are watched, but the majority are. Some are scared, some are brave, and some are smart. The imaginative kind are the most attractive. That's what makes young Phillip so appealing.
Phillip is different, wiser, stronger -- with an imagination that can't be matched. He doesn't see this -- but the boogeyman can. Will Phillip's imagination become the final piece to the boogeyman's centuries-long puzzle -- finally completing the construction of its very own world -- one that's capable of completely engulfing ours?
MAIN CHARACTERS from the series
PHILLIP HASTEN - A young boy with an incredibly gifted imagination. Phillip must stop the boogeyman's destructive quest for power over our world while also saving the lives of those he loves most.
"SOMETHING REAL" - A dangerous and reluctant boogeyman spirit that's haunted Phillip's bloodline for generations. He nears the completion of his masterful world-building project, one that could ultimately threaten our very existence on Earth.
BENJAMIN HASTEN - Phillip's long-lost father. Banjamin left his family a couple of years back for unknown reasons. This mysterious disappearance, among many others, could soon be explained with the arrival of the boogeyman.
Some of the cool stuff that's available through our campaign! Give 'em a glance or two, and if you like anything, check in with our Reward Tiers (neatly listed below) and see if you can't make it yours!
The Books - Our two covers for SOMETHING REAL #1 are available in both print and PDF formats. Cover B is signed by the writer/creator of the series and is limited to just 100 copies. THE HOLSTERED HEATHEN #1 is a work-in-progress title from the same creative team. This preview, which is available in both formats as well, will feature the first 7 completed pages of the book. A Kickstarter campaign is loosely planned to launch at the end of April for this book.
Awesomeness - The three character prints feature three separate main characters from SOMETHING REAL.The t-shirt reward offers backers the choice between two design options, coming in several different sizes (and colors upon request). An autographed script of SOMETHING REAL #1 from the series writer/creator will also be offered.
More Awesomeness - A limited poster featuring the cover art of SOMETHING REAL #2 is available and comes with a signature from the writer/creator of the series. Series artist/letterer, Ian Miller is also offering commission requests for those who back the "Simple (Boogey)Man" or "Rare Ruins" Reward Tiers. These options allow the backer to request any one character portrait of his/her choosing.
 A neat collection of all the goodies that you can acquire through our various Reward Tiers!
                ADD-ON Items
These Add-Ons can be obtained by those who have claimed/have yet to claim the "Limited Sleep" Reward Tier, and would like additional merchandise that isn't directly offered through this specific tier.
How to claim Add-Ons:
1. Click the "Manage Your Pledge" button.
2. Increase your pledge by the amount needed to claim the add-on(s).
3. Save your pledge. (Do not change the tier that you originally pledged at.)
4. We'll contact you via Kickstarter (following the end of the campaign) to ask you which add-ons you wanted and whatever necessary details.

updates.update_content:
Howdy, Kickstarter friends!
As some of you may know, we've recently made the move to Indiegogo for crowdfunding and have found some amazing support over there. We've recently crossed the $6K milestone and fast approaching 300 backers. It's been wonderful, to say the least.
We're down to the 4 FINAL DAYS for anyone who would like to get in on the first two issues of our wild boogeyman tale before the campaign ends. Thank you to everyone who supported the first book and those who have made the transition to Indiegogo with us. We're bringing the boogeyman back in style!

Hey guys,
The 2nd issue is live RIGHT NOW on Indiegogo! We hope that everyone loved the first and will want to help us out in making the second book a reality.
CAMPAIGN LINK - Click Me!
We appreciate all the generous support that you guys have given us. We won't give up on this book because we know its potential and how great it can be. So, together, let's continue to fight and get these books out into the world!

SO, some positive news this time!
(QUICK TAKE: We launch our new campaign AUGUST 30th on INDIEGOGO!)
Our team has regrouped and decided (after a bunch of thinking) to make the jump over to INDIEGOGO! That's right, we've decided to test our fund-raising abilities with a different platform. WHY? Well, honestly, there's been a huge shift in crowdfunding recently. Kickstarter is great, but more and more readers are advocating for the use of Indiegogo instead. This failed campaign gave us more than enough reason to test those waters.

ISSUE #2 Campaign Update...
First off, thank you so much to everyone who's backed this book. To those who helped us with #1 and the early backers who returned for #2, you're greatly appreciated.
That being said, we've come to the realization that we won't be able to reach our goal at this pace. Contributions have been slow since launch and so it's with heavy hearts that we've decided to cancel this campaign. We're certainly not giving up though. We have big plans for this boogey-book and its story WILL get told.

Back again with another FUN update
The colors are new completed for Something Real #1 AND The Holstered Heathen #1 preview copy. EXCITING! All we have left to do is finish up the design (fan art pages & backer support list) & touch up the lettering a bit for both titles. They're looking pretty great thus far, so I guess I ought to show you guys just a bit of what Ian & Fredrik have put together.

campaign.story:
Scientists Part One: The Prodigies
The story:
Stuart Chin thought he and his fellow prodigies were heading to a national science fair. He never imagined they would awaken to find themselves abandoned in the underground corridors of a strange experimental facility. This ragtag group of misfits must use their wits to overcome dangerous obstacles, carnivorous plants, and a relentless killer robot if they ever hope to escape from "The Scientists".
 Special for this Kickstarter is the Science of Synthwave soundtrack!
PLAY

20 original synthwave tracks 
Featuring original music from: Matt Vorn, Minemice, Stromfire, DivingInSpace, The Problem of Time, Hus K, Elevate the Sky, Dashcam, Vaughtex, & Vic-20 
Synthwave is a style of music influenced by the synthesizer-based movie soundtracks of the 1980s 
The perfect tunes to set the mood for The Scientists!
PLAY

We're Funded! Now for the Stretch Goals!!
Every backer will have access to a digital copy of this reward! If we manage to convert the entire book, I will offer it as a full 3d color printed book (in place 3d Variant cover option)
Do you love ensemble kid adventure stories, like they made back in the 80s? They were dark, dangerous, and didn’t pull their punches. If you are a fan of Stranger Things, The Goonies, or The Maze Runner, you will love The Scientists!
The Comic:
44 page double-sized comic, painted in black and white acrylic.
Cover photographed from a 3d paper diorama.
Part one of a four part mini-series that tells a complete story.
FREE SKETCH CARDS FOR BACKERS!
You'll Get a "Thank You" Sketch when you pledge. Want to make a sketch request? Leave it in the comments section!
Geoff Weber is the artist and co-creator of The Scientists. He is also a magician, inventor, game designer, husband, and father of 4 boys. 
Trent Beckett was Geoff's friend and writing partner. He enjoyed DJing "so bad, its good" 80s music and traveling throughout Europe and the Caribbean. He was a quarter-finalist in the ASA Screenwriter's Competition and wrote 8 feature length screenplays, 3 of which, he and Geoff collaborated on. The Scientists was the last project they worked on together. 
What the critics are saying about The Scientists!
Striking a pose with my friend Ho, at the comic convention
I began The Scientists over 10 years ago with my friend Trent Beckett. Everyone who knew him was devastated by his death in 2007, but I’ve found that working on this comic has helped me to maintain a feeling of connection and I promised myself that I would finish it as a way to honor him.
Why Kickstarter?
I've previously helped publish several anthology comics, but now I'm bringing my first large scale project to kickstarter to fund the printing of physical copies and to try and maximize the potential audience I can reach. I’ve already put in years of work into this comic because I really believe this is a great story the whole world needs to see!
If you've read this far, you have probably self-identified as someone who is interested in this type of story. I will only be able to print enough copies to meet the demand, which means this campaign might be the only place you can get it. So lets make this thing happen together!
-- What will the funds be used for?
The book is finished and ready to go so all the funds raised through this campaign will go towards printing, shipping, rewards, and campaign expenses. 
How the funds will be used
You want to get a sneak preview? 
I will email you the first 32 pages for free right now!
Thanks for checking out The Scientists. Be sure to join the experiment, and pledge! As soon as this project is fully funded, I will be ready to launch part two! (which is also completely finished!) You guys don’t want to miss what happens next!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With over 140 pages of art complete, I already have more than enough to launch parts one, two, and three, so you can back this project with confidence. I will be placing the printing order immediately after the campaign concludes. 

As a ComixLaunch alumni, I have done my homework on what is involved in executing a kickstarter campaign and have access to many kickstarter veterans to help me with any questions I might have. As with any kickstarter, there is always risks... but I will be completely transparent through regular updates and communication if there are any unexpected obstacles.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
White Ash is a comic book series written by Charlie Stickney with art by Conor Hughes and colors by Fin Cramb. The fifty-two page first issue launched on Kickstarter last year and thanks to our amazing backers, quickly became the best reviewed Coal Mining Fantasy/Horror/ Forbidden Romance tale of all time. (Yes, we know we’re the only C.M.F.H.F.R. comic, but still, check out these reviews.) If you’re a fan of Supernatural, Twin Peaks or Lord of the Rings, you’re going to love getting to know our mysterious town.
This campaign is to raise funds to print Chapter Two and hopefully hit a couple of Stretch Goals. (We have some incredible ones lined up that we’re dying to tell you about.)
Welcome to White Ash, a small smudge of a mining town in Western Pennsylvania, where the secrets are buried even deeper than the coal under the mountain.
In Chapter One, we met Aleck who's been counting down the hours till he can get the hell out of town and head off to college.
But an accident at the coal mine stalls his exit, setting him down a life-altering path.
One that brings him into the orbit of the enigmatic Lillian Alden. 
There's a natural chemistry between the two... some would even call it HOT. But not as hot as Thane Alden's burning rage would be if he found out Aleck was spending time with his daughter.
And Thane is only one of the many dangers that Aleck's forbidden flirtation has brought. For Lillian has her own secret agenda... an agenda that may get Aleck killed. 
Along his dangerous path, Aleck uncovers a secret about his family that changes everything he knows about himself, the people around him, and the town of White Ash.
And that was only the first issue. In Chapter Two the curtains really get pulled back on what's going on in the town. So now let's take a spoiler-free look at a couple of pages from White Ash: Chapter Two.
But, Shhhhhh, don't tell anyone we showed these to you.
    Okay, that's it. We hope you enjoyed that little taste. What's that, you want some more? Well, thanks to the White Ash Chamber of Commerce, we have a short "get to know our town" video. True, it's a bit dated, but it should give you a good sense of what life is like in our idyllic little mining community.
PLAY

What? You still need to see more before you pledge? You do? Well, okay, you can download a 25 page ashcan of Chapter One HERE.  
Money raised will go toward artist fees, printing, backer rewards and shipping of the second issue. And if we're lucky enough to surpass our goal, any additional funding will go towards creating new rewards or be put directly back into the book in the form of additional pages, and production of future issues. No one is looking to get rich here. (Otherwise we wouldn't be doing comics. Really, we wouldn't.) We just want to ensure that we can produce an amazing high-quality comic book series that our backers will enjoy for years to come.
These books are HUGE.  There's too much story in White Ash to contain it in 22 page issues. Chapter One was a 52 page beast. Chapter Two is 32 pages long. And that kind of content deserves a premium paper weight.  
We print White Ash on a heavy 85 lb glossy paper stock with a 105 lb glossy cover. When you pick up one of our books, you'll feel the White Ash difference.
This campaign we have a special Valentine's Day Variant Cover -- a tip of the cap to the Secret Romance comics of the 60's, drawn by Conor with colors by Fin Cramb. Only 300 of these will be printed and they will ONLY be sold on Kickstarter.
    We know what it's like to open up a package and find a mangled Kickstarter comic inside. We pack our books with care that we used in making the book and the love that we have for our backers.
Each comic is bagged, double-boarded and sent in stay-flat packaging. Made in White Ash means everything from the content, to the mailer we use, meets our standards of quality.
 We this time around we have a virtual treasure trove of loot, starting with...
             Stretch Goal #1 ($8,500) A Big Thank You.
 As a sign of our appreciation we’re going send every backer who’s getting a physical reward, a 6x9 print of this gorgeous thank you illustration drawn by White Ash's own Conor Hughes.
Stretch Goal #2 ($9,500) Supersize Me.
 We’re super-sizing the deluxe PDF of Chapter Two. There will be even more of how Conor and Fin break down drawing and painting a page. We’re included the full script that Charlie wrote, with annotations on how he approaches a scene. If you got our deluxe version of Chapter One, this will be like that… on steroids.
Stretch Goal #3 ($10,500) Stuck on you.
Everyone pledging at the physical reward level will receive one of these spiffy White Ash tree logo magnets. The only question is do you like them better in color…
OR classic black and white.
Backers can vote and make their choice known.
 Stretch Goal #4 ($12,000) NICK ROBLES VARIANT COVER.
 Nick's bringing his amazing talent from IDW, BOOM and VAULT to White Ash to do an exclusive Kickstarter VARIANT COVER for our backers. Everyone who pledging at the BOTH COVERS level or higher, will get one N.R. variant cover added to their haul for FREE. And if you pledge at the Variant Cover tier, you’ll have a choice between our V-Day cover and whatever the man who did this…
...comes up with for White Ash: Chapter Two. These variants are Kickstarter exclusives and will NOT be offered again. We are only be printing up enough for our fabulous backers. So if you want one, make sure you’re pledged at tier that includes them.
Stretch Goal #5 ($14,00) TRADE ME PLEASE
 We’re printing up a set of four White Ash Trading Cards featuring our favorite residents. All backers who pledged at The Book Tier will get one randomly selected card. Everyone who pledged at a higher tier will get the whole set. Conor and Fin are going to design some new artwork, exclusive to the cards. They’re going to the ultimate White Ash collectable.
And seeing as we hit 14K with 40 hours left to go, we're going to see how big we can make the card set. So for every additional $500 we raise, we’ll add another card to the set. So at $14,500 we’ll do 5 cards… at $15,000 we’ll do six… and so on.
And if we hit 15K, EVERY BACKER getting a physical reward, will get the full set of cards (whatever the number).  So tell your friends that there's even more White Ash to be had.
And thank you again for all the support for our project.  We're thrilled that you want to be part of what we're building. It means the world to us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We learned a lot from our first Kickstarter. Even though we did our best to ship our rewards on schedule, in the end we were a little delayed when it came to delivery. This was due to underestimating how long it would take to make 52 pages (Chapter One was a beast) and our books literarily missing the boat that was supposed to take them across the ocean.

This time around we changed one huge piece of the puzzle, the book is done. 100% complete. So as soon as the KS funds, it’s off to the printer. PDF copies should be in everyone’s hands within a couple of weeks of the campaign ending.

Sure, there’s always a chance there could be another delay. Things happen. Have you watched Hitchcock’s The Birds? You do not want to screw with an animal that can dive bomb your head with a beak and talons. So, that being said, if our suppliers are dealing with a feathery situation, we promise to keep you apprised and let you know if the timetable changes. We want all our backers to be part of White Ash for a long time. To us, we see this as the beginning of a beautiful relationship. And if you've actually read all this, it seems that relationship has already begun. So thank you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello White Ashians,
This morning we launched the Kickstarter for White Ash: Chapter Four.

Hello White Ashians,
Conor, Fin and I wanted to give you a quick status update on the shipping for the Chapter One/Two rewards. At this point, all the domestic rewards that we have addresses for, have shipped. So if you live in the United States and you haven’t received your rewards and we haven’t reached out to you personally, please get in contact with us ASAP so we can get you your books.

Dear White Ashians,
Conor, Fin and I just want to thank you for turning out in such epic force on day one of our kickstarter for Chapter Three.  We're tearing up the KS charts and it's all because of  you.  The first day surge makes a HUGE difference on the platform, so thank you, thank you.
Knowing that so many of you have already joined us for Chapter Three, it almost feels silly posting this, but we don't want any of you to miss out, if you want to get a copy of the the book. So White Ash public service announcement, for the .... we're still offering an on  After that, the tier will go away.

Hello White Ashians,
Hopefully by now, many of you have received your packages from us.  Charlie's been a one man shipping station, working overtime to get your books out. At this point, 90% of all domestic packages have shipped.  So if you live in the United States and don't have your books yet, they should be there by early next week.  The only exception to this is if you're waiting for a signed comic. Those take a bit longer as they have to go to Conor first.  But the goal is by the end of next week to have those delivered as well.

Hello White Ashians,
Feast your eyes on these...

Hello White Ashians,
Quick Monday update for you.  You should have just received a notification from Backerkit with a link for downloading the deluxe PDF version of Chapter Two.  It was actually pushed out to you late last week, but someone (ahem, Charlie) may have not realized there was a notification email button that also needed pressed. Anyway, there's a really cool write-up in it from Conor and Fin breaking down their respective processes coloring the spread, some art from the campaign and loads of other extras.  Hope you enjoy.

Hello White Ashians,
It’s that other most wonderful time of the year, when the weather warms, spirits perk up, clothing is...  reduced, and the hounds are unleashed.

campaign.story:
ABOUT
Lord and Lady Ravenscroft are two brilliant scientists and inventors whose Bohemian lifestyle and inventive ways are in direct contrast to the staid and proper ways of Victorian Era London.
Served faithfully by their steam-driven metallic Majordomo, Pneuman, and armed with a variety of elaborate self-created inventions, the Ravenscrofts pursue the one vocation that brings excitement into their world... solving murders!
PREVIOUSLY...
Brought in to consult on a mysterious murder, the Ravenscrofts began hunting down clues that might lead them to the devious culprit. Making waves and alerting the wrong people to their efforts nearly cost them their lives.
Now, the case takes them to Austria to seek out the next piece to this chaotic puzzle of murder and mayhem they've found themselves wrapped up in.
Fans of mystery and suspense stories will love Pneumatic Cases!
Gears, pistons and automatons!
If you like a little Science Fiction tossed in with your Steampunk fare, this book is for you!
Travel across the European landscape with the Ravenscrofts as they track down a murderer!
22 exciting interior pages of story! 
Rated T for Teen.
STRETCH GOALS
Here are some extra items we cooked up we thought you might enjoy! More to come if we happen to get there!
This first one is now unlocked! A variant cover inspired by Scooby Doo of our cast by CrankRats artist Katherine Ellis! Digital backers will get a digital copy of PC #2 with this cover, and physical backers will get a physical copy of PC #2!
 As I announced in an update, the cover we've used throughout the campaign is a placeholder. The actual cover, by the same series artist, Rowel Roque, is equally impressive, just not colored yet. Now that we reached this one, digital and physical backers will get a mini-print of the image digitally or physically respectively!
Our third stretch goal is a set of three (3) Pneumatic Cases buttons for all physical level backers!
ADD-ONS
You can add these additional items to your pledge amount with no extra shipping costs! These are for physical copy backers. If you'd like to add-on to a digital tier, there will be a shipping cost added. Keep that in mind!
THE CAST
Lord Rupert Percival Ravenscroft, Percy for short, is a stylish but disheveled man in his mid 30s. When he's not solving crimes with his lovely bride Annie, he can be found toiling away in his lab and naming common household appliances with unnecessarily long and complicated titles. Percy is openly loving and affectionate to his wife and is a bonafide genius. He created their majordomo Pneuman.
Lady Anastasia Elizabeth Ravenscroft, Annie for short, is a forward thinker for her time. She's brazen and outspoken, yet classy and aluring. She doesn't take too kindly to being told what a woman's place is and she'll let you know about it. She is in her late 20s and adores her intelligent husband, though she keeps him on his toes. An inventor in her own right, Annie's creations are small, elegant and powerful, with simple names to match.
THE TEAM
THE BUZZ
THE WHY
John Wilson, the creator and writer of Pneumatic Cases (PC), and one of the founding members of Last Ember Press is an avid Steampunk fan as well as a fan of Holmesian murder mysteries. PC is a book he was working on for years trying to get off the ground before LEP was formed. It became one of our two launch titles and remains one of our best sellers online and at conventions.
The reason we have turned to Kickstarter for this issue is to fund printing costs and get Pneumatic Cases #2 into the hands of eager readers as soon as possible. The pencils and inks are complete, and the coloring and lettering is underway! 
With Make/100 returning, we thought it would be a great opportunity to offer a cool and unique limited item to celebrate and commemorate the release of this issue.
WHAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR
Since the pencils and inks are done, and as we are currently coloring and lettering the remainder of the issue in-house (as you read this!), we are looking to use the Kickstarter funds to pay for the printing and shipping costs and the various other expenses that go with a comic project. You can see the breakdown below:
PREVIEW THE BOOK!
          THE REWARDS
Make/100
For our part in Kickstarter's Make/100 promotion, we present this limited edition, one-of-a-kind clear charm featuring Lord and Lady Ravenscroft in a heart-shaped steampunk magnifying glass surrounded by hearts and roses! See the tiers below for details on how to get this exclusive charm!
Tiers
Extras
Extras As we reach certain milestones in the campaign, we are adding these additional rewards to the packages backers will receive! We have two that go to ALL backers and two that just go to backers at physical levels.
THE PLAN
Here's a projected timeline for completion of the book, though we do expect it to be done sooner!
THANK YOU!
On behalf of John, Rowel, Lisa, myself and everyone with Last Ember Press, we can't thank you enough for your all your continued support! This issue has been a long time coming and we can't wait to get it in your hands sooner than later!
And we sincerely hope you enjoy this one-of-a-kind Kickstarter exclusive, limited edition Pneumatic Cases charm! It's a gorgeous piece of art by very talented artist Elena Ferroli!
Please spread the word and share your support of Pneumatic Cases #2 with all your friends. We are shooting to complete this 4-issue story this year, so the sooner we can get this one funded the sooner we can get the rest in production as well!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the art is complete for this book and does not hinge on funding. This book will be completed and shipped to you as soon as possible.

While we are still in the process of completing The Last Ember, which was successfully funded in November 2017, this book is not contingent on that one being completed before it is ready to ship.

We are always open to any concerns or questions you may have, so please don't hesitate to ask!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Glow is an ongoing comic series by Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero with art by Anny Maulina and Dia Jia. 
The goal of this Kickstarter is to raise print funds for issue #2. Any additional funds will go directly towards the production of further issues of the series. 
Glow takes place in a world where magic catalyzed both industrial revolution and nuclear holocaust. Half a millennia ago, an ancient and powerful empire known as Nymera developed a means to channel and store magical energy into a sticky blue substance known as anima, storing them into massive Towers across the world.
 With the aid of the Towers, the Nymerans brought peace and paradise into the world. Until one day the Towers fell.
The story of Glow takes place two hundred years after that cataclysmic event, and follows the story of those who remain.
Issue One introduced us to Caszy and Koken, siblings scavengers of the Wastes with extraordinary abilities.
Issue Two continues the story as the witch Myra makes a compelling proposition.
Variant Cover illustrated by Melissa Pagluica. Image links to her website.
Magic in Glow is channeled through the language of ancient Nymera, the former masters of the world. In order to flesh out this cornerstone of the story, we've been collaborating with Colm Doyle, an Estonian linguist and enthusiastic conlanger.
Nymeran is used a number of ways in the comic, including sound effects. 
Each digital edition of Glow comes with a language guide that teaches you the secrets of ancient Nymeran. 
Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero are the writers and creators of Glow. Together, they’re the founders of the creative imprint known as Mythopoeia. Glow is their second comic book series after the the dieselpunk airship adventure Skies of Fire. Ray is based in Los Angeles and Vince in London.
Anny Maulina is an artist from Indonesia and creator of the webcomic Raruurien. She also enjoys working on comic and art projects on her spare time. You can find her on Patreon and DeviantArt. 
Dia Ja was born in Iloilio City, Philippines and moved to California with her family. She graduated at Los Angeles County High School for the Arts in 2014, and is currently attending ArtCenter College of Design for Illustration. Check out her tumblr.
Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects, including Skies of Fire and Witchblade. @bryan_valenza
Born in Barcelona, Cristian Docolomansky Cerda (C.D.C.) is an inker and letterer based in Chile. He's worked with several publishers such as Alterna Comics, IDW, and Ariete Producciones. You can find him here.
From Ireland, Colm Ó Dúill is a verification specialist at TransferWise's office in Tallinn, Estonia, where he has lived since 2007. He holds an M.Phil. in Applied Linguistics and a B.Comm with French, and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Linguistics. He is married with two children, and has been dabbling in creating constructed languages since 2005; Nymeran is his first developed constructed language.
Kendrick See is a full time concept artist and illustrator from Malaysia. He is currently working in the video game industry, and his job scope ranges from creating various idea development pieces, to breakdowns and 3D paintovers. He helped bring Shoddai to life with a map! http://sourshade.deviantart.com/
Giulia Frontoni is an Italian illustrator based in Rome with a focus on creature designs. She helped bring to life many of the beasts found in Glow, as well as the postcards and button pinups! http://nondev.deviantart.com/
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our sixth Kickstarter project, and as always the biggest risk is timely delivery. Last year we had a lot of issues regarding our manufacturers, and the lesson we took at the end of it all was that we need to be better.

For 2018, we want to ship our projects in as timely a manner as possible. We've set a deadline for this project of April and think we can wrap everything up by then. The only new manufacturing needed for this Kickstarter are the print copies for #2 as well as some runic pendants. Everything else is in stock and ready to go.

We'll do our best to improve our logistics, but are also committed to top quality customer support. If you ever have an issue, please let us know and we'll do our best to fix it. You can ask our previous backers - we do our best to make sure they're 100% satisfied.

At the end of the day, Mythopoeia is just Vince and Ray. We both have full time jobs outside of comics, but we're passionate about what we do and are committed to grow. We hope that comes across in the work.

campaign.story:
Feared, hated, and hunted. Vampires exist, but not those of myth and legend.
They are just like us, good, bad, but mostly afraid. They're afraid of the light, of people, of each other, of being found out, and of dying again.
Catherine Morrison has spent the better part of 900 years walking the line between humans and vampires...protecting her people from the worst of humanity and humanity from the worst of her people.
She is loved, feared, and sometimes even hated, but she's never been hunted.
Until now.
Diary of Night Volume 1 - Distant Thunder
Softcover - 130 pages
 - Collects Diary of Night #'s 1, 2, 3, & 4
 - Includes Pin-ups
 - Includes 4 New Diary Entries
 - 85 lb. stock

Hardcover contains 16 Bonus pages of Behind the Scenes material.
Campaign Exclusives include digital rewards, bookmarks, postcards, prints, signed bookplates, and even participation in the creation of new content for this collection.
  Will Allred is a writer, professor, and technologist. He created and wrote Diary of Night for BloodFire Studios, contributed to the Eisner-nominated Comics through Time and multiple other academic books on comics, and is writing a second novel.
Gene Gonzales is an illustrator living in Florida. Gene works in both digital and traditional mediums. He has created artwork for business training, graphic facilitation, primary, secondary and higher education text books, comic books, movies, and licensing.
Rus Wooton is a veteran letterer who has worked for Image Comics, Marvel Comics, Radical Comics, Archaia, and Dark Horse Comics. In addition, he is a freelance illustrator, graphic designer, and cartoonist.  
Diary of Night needs to be available in print again as a collected edition not only because I'm proud of the work we did, but also to provide resources to fund more comics projects. We need these resources to continue creating more projects that matter to us, thought-provoking projects that involve literature, art, history, science, math, and technology that will inspire, educate, and entertain.
We're coming to Kickstarter to help raise funds for a large offset print run of at least 1000 copies of the Diary of Night Volume 1 softcover and at least 200 copies of the hardcover.
The book is 100% complete and ready to go to print. We've come to Kickstarter to help get the book into as many hands as possible, and would love your support to bring it to life.
Here's how we plan to spend the funds.
Project Budget

                                    In addition, all backers will receive...
Digital copies of Hell Strawberry First Chronicle by Ludovic Sallè, The Last Ember #0 by Brant Fowler, John Wilson, Rudi Sucipto, Lisa Moore, and Tart Volume 1: Adrift by Kevin Joseph and Ludovic Sallè!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a member of the Kickstarter community, I respect your choice to back Diary of Night with your hard-earned money and have made every effort to minimize the risks associated with this campaign to backers.

The greatest risk to you as a backer is normally that the project never gets finished. In this case, that simply cannot happen as the project is already finished.

Now, it just needs to be printed, and I have been in contact with multiple printers to ensure the book gets printed quickly upon the completion of the campaign.

The campaign, however, will not truly be complete until every backer receives his or her rewards.

If you haven any questions or concerns about this project, please don't hesitate to contact me.

Again, I thank you for your time and your support.

campaign.story:
We are a group of Best Friends who have been going to the International School of Comics for nearly 3 years. We are graduating soon, and hope to become big name comic book artists one day. This Anthology comprises our first steps in that direction. 
The Super Duper Friends
Each of us wrote, pencilled and inked a story, and we compiled them into this more than 200 page book. The story themes are varied, ranging from horror to humor, so there is something for everybody! Our art styles are very different too.
This project required a lot of sweat and tears (mostly sweat, ammiright Dan?!) and we really hope it gets funded. 
The Super Duper Anthology
  Gods
       Chernobyl Children
  The Mage's Apprentice
  Fatale Attraction
  The Cactus Witch
  The Hot Dog
  The Drake Equation
  The Possession of Isolde Hywl
  Spot and Dot
         Presuming everything goes well with the printers and there are no delays, the books should arrive by boat to the US in April of 2018. Then the Super Duper friends will fulfill the orders and have them sent out to you within a week, depending on how many orders we get. Expect the book at your front door within the month! 
Kickstarter is a worldwide crowd funding platform that helps artists and creators fund their projects. You will not be charged until after the funding period is over, which is typically within 7 days of the end of a project.  The next step will be sending the finalized files to the printer overseas, who will begin the printing process. The longest part is yet to come, however, since shipping takes a few weeks, by boat. Our delivery deadline is April 2018, so in February you can expect to receive a survey through Kickstarter asking for your address. We ask that you fill out the survey in a timely manner, so we can avoid delays in getting our Super Duper book to you!

updates.update_userinfo: *cue happy dance* The Books are IN!!!!!
updates.update_content:
Dear Super Duper Backers: First off, Happy New Year to you all! To start off the New Year, we have some bad news as well as some great news.  
Let’s get the bad news out of the way first. In prepping to ship out the new books, we needed to explore various options on the best and safest way to send out the books. We found that the cardboard backing and bubble wrap we had initially planned on, just wouldn’t work. And then there were the holidays. Peace on earth and good will toward men, yes, but it brought a lot of things came to a screeching halt.

Hi there, Super Duper backers! Milena here, with another Super Duper Update. The Super Duper Stickers that will come with every order have arrived!! They are glossy vinyl, so you don’t have to worry about them getting damaged! I am a huge sticker fiend, so I am absolutely ecstatic about these! Now, the books. Which are arguably the most important part really. They have been on their way for a while now. But since all the hurricanes and things that are beyond our control, they’ve been held up in the ocean for a while, on their way here from Taiwan. They were scheduled to arrive last week, but now we hope they will be here by the end of the month - in which case we will hustle to get them shipped to y’all as soon as possible! We are very grateful for your patience and understanding with these setbacks. I will see you in the next update! Sincerely Milena on behalf of the Super Duper Friends

Hello hello, Super Duper backers!
Milena again, as per usual, back with another update!
Our printer has our files and sent the book to print on August 2nd, and it will take 8-10 weeks to print. After that the real fun starts lol: the packing and shipping. We will do our best to do that in a timely manner, to get he books to you all as soon as possible. :)

Dear friends and backers, 
Milena here, reporting from the trenches! 
We finally, and I mean FINALLY, are ready to send the files to the printers. 
We really appreciate the patience you all have demonstrated. Admittedly the process of creating a book was more complicated than we thought. Also, you try herding artists together to get stuff done! It's  like herding cats! And everyone knows you can't get cats to do anything you want them to do, when you want them to do it.

Hey everybody!!!
Milena here, again, with another super duper update (again :P)
I am happy to announce that all of us have now finished our comics and turned them in for compiling the PDF to go to the printer. I want to take a moment to thank everyone for their support, and for their patience while we noobs are putting together this anthology for you guys. :) it is deeply appreciated!

Hey everybody! Lovely backers and friends!
Milena here, bringing you another update fresh off the oven. While production is still undergoing, I am happy to say that myself, Mike Ortiz and Dapper Dan have finished our comics, whilst the other Super Duper Friends only have lettering left to do. Lettering. It is harder than you would think, honestly, and it is time consuming. So please accept our apologies, since we will probably not have the copies out to you by April as we first thought, but it will be probably closer to July. We understand that this is an inconvenience since y’all want to see the Anthology just as bad as we do, and hold that precious, beautiful hardcover in your hands and smell that new book smell... ok maybe that last one is just me. But! Fret not because we are working on it diligently and are committed to bringing you the best product possible. We deeply appreciate you guys’ support and we couldn’t have made it this far without you.

Hey there, Dear Backers!
The Super Duper Friends are polishing their comics. We want to make sure everything is made to the highest quality we can make it. Since this is the first professionally made book we have done, we are working through more edits and technical difficulties. 
Though we are having troubles we are working through them as a group. Please hold tight for more progress and updates.

campaign.story:
STAIN THE SEAS SCARLET is a brutal sci fi one-shot comic about Yelena, a resistance leader on a distant planet, who plays one last hand against the shitty robots tearing her world and life apart.
This Kickstarter is for the complete 22 page full colour comic by artist Alex Cormack [SINK and OXYMORON: THE LOVELIEST NIGHTMARE] and writer Ryan K Lindsay [BEAUTIFUL CANVAS and the award-winning NEGATIVE SPACE] as a PDF/digital release.
When Yelena's planet has just about been successfully driven beneath the bootheel of the scumbag robot terraforming army, she throws a Hail Mary play. She takes the fight to them, via her diplomatic sell out sister, and she fails.
Or does she?
What comes next is a wild ride of spacesuit noir that's my take on a 70s revenge flick with our wandering hero loose in space.
This comic is 100% made and completely ready to deliver.
Alex Cormack is amazing. The world recently lost their mind over his work on SINK, with John Lees through ComixTribe, and his work on this comic is superb as he brings gristle and emotion to the page.
Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou letters with the style that's making him a stadium-filling favourite across all the continents.
Dan Hill edits his ass off to make this a better book. He is smart, has edited most of my other creator owned books, and his name is quickly becoming a signifier of sharp erudition.
And I'm Ryan K Lindsay, and I've written what were hopefully some of your favourite indie miniseries of the past few years - BEAUTIFUL CANVAS with Sami Kivela at Black Mask, NEGATIVE SPACE with Owen Gieni at Dark Horse, and HEADSPACE with Eric Zawadzki at Monkeybrain/IDW.
I have also previously run 5 successful comic Kickstarter campaigns, raising ~$20,000 across 3 years on this platform, I've yet to fail, and I always deliver. Sometimes I even over-deliver by rolling out unlocked rewards and stretch goals just because you're amazing.
ALL DIGITAL, ALL THE TIME
This campaign is an all-digital, all-singing, all-dancing affair. You can purchase the PDF of StSS here, there will be no print copies available as a basic tier [kinda, maybe].
You can get the PDF, as well as upsized PDFs, audio content, and we keep it simple like this because shipping books outta Australia is a logistical nightmare, and also because with a PDF we can make it as many extra pages as we want to. So this helps both me and you.
Although, there are some actual 'irl rewards' on offer. You can buy original art, or annotated scripts, and a special Variant Cover Print Copy will be unlocked [see below for more details].
~~~~~FIRST DAY BACKER PARTY~~~~~
To say thank you to everyone who already follows me, and came into the campaign early, which helps spread the word, I wanted to thank you all and reward you all, so here's the deal: all first day backers will get downloads at the end of that day for:
OXYMORON: THE LOVELIEST NIGHTMARE #1 from Alex Cormack and John Lees
HEADSPACE #1 from Eric Zawadzki and Ryan K Lindsay
CHUM #1 from Sami Kivela and Ryan K Lindsay
~~~~~~~PLEDGE LEVELS~~~~~~~
Here's the important stuff, what can you get, and how much will it set you back. NOTE: all $s are set in Aussie $s [the USA $s convert to a small number].
$2 StSS PDF Comic
You get the full 22 page comic PDF delivered straight to your inbox.
This level will receive some digital extras as we hit Stretch Goals.
$4 StSS Deluxe PDF Comic
You get the full 22 page comic PDF backed up with pages and pages of extra material: back matter, essays, lists, process material, and the full script. Perfect for the process junkies nodding along.
This level will receive most digital extras as we hit Stretch Goals.
$7 StSS Deluxe PDF Pack!
You get the full 22 page comic PDF backed up with pages and pages of extra material: back matter, essays, lists, process material, and the full script. You also get 'The RKL Scriptbook Vol. 4" feat. scripts for a variety of other projects I've written.
This level will receive ALL digital extras as we hit Stretch Goals.

~~~~~~~STRETCH GOALS~~~~~~~
Stretch Goals will be digital downloads and will release in direct messages, from me to you, throughout the campaign, and in selective tiers.

For each milestone we surpass, Stretch Goals for different pledge tiers will unlock. The more you've pledged, the more unlocks you'll get in your inbox at each milestone - with higher pledge tiers getting all unlocked content. Make sense?

Check below for a list of the Stretch Goals, and what pledge tiers get which ones.

These will unlock at $30 each, which will also cover postage anywhere.
We'll also add the following downloads:
