campaign.story:
From the magnificently masterful mind of Paul Dini comes a new 48-page graphic novel that turns the game of cat and mouse on its (paranormal) head … BOO & HISS! How many comics and cartoons have you seen where the cat chases the mouse endlessly, rarely catching him and never succeeding in vanquishing his rodent nemesis? In the world of BOO & HISS, that all changes: Hiss (the cat) catches Boo (the mouse) and DEVOURS him. There’s no coming back from that, right? WRONG! That’s where the story really begins! Boo returns as a ghost to enact vengeance on his feline murderer. 
Wherever Hiss goes, Boo follows, tormenting him in various ways: nearly scaring him to death, possessing his body and making him do terrible and embarrassing things, and just generally making his life a living hell. The cat becomes the hunted and the ghost mouse the hunter in the twisted, comic, scary, and poignant world of BOO & HISS! 
Check out 7 pages of BOO & HISS below, written by Paul Dini with art by Dave Alvarez. And then get ready for the graphic novel, which will be overflowing with cat-astrophic calamities and mouse-y mayhem!
One of several potential covers for the graphic novel (non-KS exclusive version)
  Who Is Paul Dini?
As the fervent followers of the Emmy and Eisner Award-winning Paul Dini know, he’s been a writer and/or producer on some of the greatest projects in cartoons, TV, and comics in the last few decades. Here’s just a sampling: Tiny Toon Adventures, Batman: The Animated Series, Superman: The Animated Series, Batman Beyond, Justice League, Freakazoid!, and Lost. He was also the writer of the blockbuster video games Batman: Arkham Asylum and Batman: Arkham City. Dini recently wrote the #1 New York Times bestseller Dark Night: A True Batman Story. And if you’re a fan of the Joker’s madcap gal pal, Harley Quinn, well, Paul Dini co-created her too!  
Paul Dini
Who Is Dave Alvarez?  
Even the greatest graphic novel story in the world won’t fly if the art isn’t up to snuff. Thankfully, in the case of BOO & HISS, the art is spectacular, due to the tremendous talents of David Alvarez. His eye-catching drawings for the graphic novel are reminiscent of classic cartoons and comics, providing a douse of nostalgia while illustrating the brand-new world of BOO & HISS. David Alvarez’s past work includes the Looney Tunes and Animaniacs comic books. He is also the creator of the internationally popular comic strip Yenny.
Dave Alvarez
Why Kickstarter?
Due to all of the amazing work he has done, Paul Dini has a lot of fans. There are literally Dini fans of every age, gender, and race. However, it can be REALLY difficult to reach all those fans using the traditional publishing model. Plus, even for Paul Dini, it’s not that easy to get publishers behind a brand-new project no one has heard of yet. 
So, he decided to go directly to his fans. Kickstarter is the perfect place to go to get the word out and reach tons of the Dini supporters out there. Plus, we know there are comics fans on Kickstarter who will love the originality and eye-catching style of BOO & HISS! 
If you’re familiar with the work of Paul Dini, you know the quality of work he ALWAYS produces. So, backers, you better be ready: You’re going to get something whimsical and wonderful with BOO & HISS. 
Who (or What) Is Erasmus Fox? 
Erasmus Fox is an entertainment company dedicated to working with talented creators to bring their projects to life. The small team at Erasmus Fox has decades of experience producing amazing content and is excited to bring high-quality comics, books, collectibles, and board games into the world. We’re beyond pumped to present Paul Dini’s incredible project and make sure all his loyal fans get their rewards in a timely manner. 
The First Boo & Hiss Comic: "Surprise Possession"
            More Art
Come back to this space throughout the campaign for new BOO & HISS art, including some sketches, character designs, and more!
Kickstarter-exclusive Stephanie Buscema cover
  "Mouseance": BOO & HISS print by Stephanie Buscema that backers of the Ghostly Print Tier (and above) will get!
  "Pennywise" by Dave Alvarez
  "Boobusters" by Dave Alvarez
  Weejean designs by Stephanie Buscema
  Boo designs (sketches) by Dave Alvarez
  Boo designs (colored) by Dave Alvarez
  Hiss designs (sketches) by Dave Alvarez
  Hiss designs (colored) by Dave Alvarez
  BOO & HISS short comic (written by Paul Dini, art by Dave Alvarez)
  One of several potential covers for the graphic novel (non-KS exclusive version)
Shipping
Shipping is a flat rate: $5 for all of the tiers except for the Retailer Tier. We will only ship to the United States. Shipping fees will be added right after you pledge. We will NOT be using a Pledge Manager; there will be a survey via Kickstarter to collect your shipping information after the campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The estimated delivery date for the BOO & HISS graphic novel is May 2018 and Paul Dini and Erasmus Fox will do everything in their power to deliver on time. However, please keep in mind that this is a projected date. Unexpected delays can occur during the production and shipping of any product. The team is committed to producing a high quality graphic novel and are not willing to deliver anything that’s less than amazing to the fans out there. 

In the highly unlikely event that we are not able to deliver the graphic novel for some unforeseeable, calamitous reason (like a ghost mouse terrorizing Paul Dini), we will refund all pledges.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
BOO & HISS backers,
All rewards have been mailed out! If you haven't already received your book, you should within the next few days. We hope everyone loves the final product! Thank you so much for your patience. We will be sending out PDF copies next week.
If you did not fill out your survey before we mailed books out: Please email us at support@erasmusfox.com with your name and shipping address. Also, let us know if you pledged extra during the campaign for additional copies of the book (it was $15 each). If you only pledged for a PDF copy of the book, please just provide your name and confirm your preferred email address.

Dear backers,
Paul has finished signing copies of BOO & HISS for those who pledged to receive signed books. Photo below! Paul is really happy with how the book turned out and can't wait for you to receive it.

Dear backers,
At last, copies of BOO & HISS have arrived! Please see a couple photos below that show the regular and Kickstarter-exclusive covers. Paul is going to sign copies this week and then we'll start sending them out!
We will send PDF copies to everyone after the physical copies have shipped out. We want to make sure the backers who pledged to receive copies of the OGN are able to experience it that way first.

Dear Backers,
We are sorry for the lack of communication. There were some delays with the printer, but we now have it confirmed that copies of BOO & HISS will be arriving October 10-14. Prints have already arrived and Paul has finished all the sketch cards.
Once the books arrive, we'll post an update with some photos. The next step after that will be getting Paul to sign books for the backers who pledged for the corresponding tiers. Then we'll start shipping immediately. We plan to have books in the mail before Halloween, which (given the spooky content inside) would be really appropriate.

Annnnd...we're done! BOO & HISS is wrapped, at the printers and soon will be floating its ghostly way to you, our awesome, amazing and fantastically patient supporters! Dave and I and everyone at Erasmus Fox deeply thank you and appreciate you sticking with us on this admittedly rocky journey. 
We apologize again for the frequent delays and hope that you will find our frightfully funny tale of creeped-out cats, ghost mice and demon dachshunds worth the wait. Also, we will be sending out surveys soon to get your addresses for shipping, so be sure to watch for them.

As we head into our final lap, Dave and I are thrilled to introduce you to our newest character, one who will have a profound effect on Boo & Hiss from this point forward!
In many ways little Weejean Merrydew is just like any ordinary kid -- an ordinary kid whose parents happen to run a mortuary for departed humans and their pets. A descendant of sorcerers, mystics, ghouls and other creepers, Weejean is no slouch as a fledgling Medium, able to communicate with ghosts and banish evil spirits when the need arises. But will even her powers be enough when the devil's dog comes calling?

Hiss's past catches up with him in the form of Boo, the ghost of the cartoon mouse he ate in a fit of rage. Now it's the mouse's turn to toy with the cat. But don't worry, Boo won't scare his feline enemy to death...yet.

To the Devil, a Dachshund! 
I've had the twisted pleasure of writing many colorful villains in cartoons and comics, but I really have grown to love Skippy, the demonic wiener dog of Old Scratch himself. 
Dave and I can't wait for you to meet this malevolent menace to both Boo and Hiss, and we'll be featuring him more in coming updates.  Fun fact: Skippy's look was partially inspired by the mascot of the dear, defunct Doggie Diner, a chain of hot dog stands popular when I was a kid in the San Francisco area. FYI, there is no chain of Angel Mouse Diners anywhere that I'm aware of, but here's a peek at Adoraboo's celestial guardian, Angelina. You'll see more of her, too.

updates.update_userinfo: Boo, the Princess, and the devilishly mysterious stranger
updates.update_content:
We are closing in on the finish, friends! To keep you in the loop, we'll be posting updates with much more art every few days as we close up our tale. Thanks for sticking with us! Here's today's look at our work in progress:
Little known fact: Before he hit it big in Mouse VS Cat comedies, Beaufort Jarlsberg Mouse, AKA Li'l Adoraboo, AKA Boo, slogged along in such thankless roles as "Attendant Vermin #3" in big budget fantasy Princess movies. Unfortunately he wasn't great at his job, and he spent many sad years watching other animal actors become stars. But all that changed during a New Year's Eve party when Bo made the acquaintance of a devilishly mysterious stranger...

updates.update_userinfo: "Whoa! The censor will have a field day with this one!"
updates.update_content:
So speaks the Director and her crew of "Easy Cheesy," Li'l Adoraboo's latest comedy epic. However, for the first time in his long career, Adoraboo is not working with a stunt cat, and things are about to get messy.
Thanks again to our incredible backers as Dave and I hurry to finish up the book. We appreciate your patience and hope you will be delighted with the end result.
Best,

campaign.story:
WHAT'S LEVELS ABOUT?
Levels is about a virus that is unleashed into a large skyscraper building by a disgruntled former worker. The virus brainwashes office workers into becoming bloodthirsty psychopathic maniacs intent solely on causing harm to everyone around them. As this is unfolding, a window cleaner named Frankie Barrett gets himself trap at the top of the skyscraper and his only option to get out of trouble is to break into the building from outside. Cue Frankie finding out very quickly what is occurring in the building and having to figure out how he is going to escape alive. Action, horror and dark humour combine to give this title a full throttle paced adventure that we hope will thrill readers everywhere!
PREVIEW OF THE BOOK
The nefarious Maxwell Dutch executing his plan!
  Frankie Barrett coming face to face with his first challenge...
  Anyone for golf?
  Can Frankie piece together what's happening before it's too late? Find out what is really going on by backing our campaign!
THE PEOPLE BEHIND THE PROJECT
Richard Allan (R) Greg Liddle (Centre) , Tommy Cree (Left)
The team behind Levels consisted of writers Richard Allan and Greg Liddle, penciller Karl Engracia, inker Nathan Allison, letterer Toben Racicot and additional end product consultancy by Tommy Cree.
Richard and Greg are based in Edinburgh, Scotland and have been writing together since 2013. Both are ardent comic book fans and intend to carry on writing together in future. With Levels issues two and three already written, they plan to go back and finish off their first series, 'The Plight'.
Karl Engracia is based in the Phillipines. Karl has a strong track record of penciling for various projects, one of which is Desert Whale Comics' very own 'Levels' run. Incredibly detailed and painstakingly accurate, Karl brought the script's ideas to life by crafting beautiful work throughout.
Nathan Allison is an artist and musician based just outside of Edinburgh, Scotland and, incredibly, Levels was the first comic book project he has undertaken. Nathan added depth, colour and a huge amount of innovative ideas to the table throughout. He will be inking Levels issues two and three, with two already underway.
Toben Racicot is based in Canada. Precise and easy to work with, Toben produced letters for Levels in a very short time frame, producing excellent work throughout. 
Tommy Cree is based in Edinburgh, Scotland and is a freelance comic book artist in his spare time. Tommy is the sole illustrator for our first comic, 'The Plight', and is currently illustrating the second issue.
Published by Rats & Crows Publishing: ''Our mission: To be a publishing agency that rewards the merit of creators and honors its responsibilities to them. To elevate the medium by encouraging risk-taking challenges to the norms of storytelling through comics. To publish great books to a global market, with attention to detail and the desires of creators.'' - Kevin Roditeli (President of Rats & Crows Publishing)
WHERE THE MONEY GOES?
What's really cool about our campaign: The book is 100% finished. So all money collected will go into printing the copies & producing the kickstarter rewards!

The book is 100% completed - All funds collected will go into the printing. The only challenge we got is to respect that we will ship it for Halloween to every backer!

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Tom Lintern and this campaign is for my graphic novel Girrion. This campaign is specifically for the funding the creation Issues 8 and 9, which will complete Volume1. That means MOST of the book is already complete. I only have about 50 pages to go out of the 225+ pages in the series.
New to the story? Not to worry!  All of Volume 1 is available in this campaign. Also Issues 8 and 9 will be of course available as well for those who have already been following along.
Thanks to the lovely and amazing Kickstarter community I've had Issues 2 - 7 funded on previous campaigns. This project began years ago and has slowly turned into something I am really devoted to and would love to work on for years to come.
GIRRION is a sweeping sci-fi fantasy story of a hero's journey in a distant world in a distant time. The saga is told through the eyes of Jarra, a poor factory worker who dreams of escaping his world of endless toil. His wish comes true, though not in a way he would have ever wanted, when his city is attacked by a dark entity called the Halodron. He escapes the conflict, but only to be thrust into a war of other-worldy magic and weaponry.
Amidst the destruction, history begins to unravel as soldiers of a forgotten war resurface and the secrets of a mysterious technology known as Girrion come to light as its scattered remains suddenly start to “reawaken”. With little time and resources, the hero must help save his crumbling empire from its destructive past.
        Inking in progress
        Volume 1 cover art in progress
     Girrion started off as a hobby over 15 years ago. Initially it was more of an illustration portfolio than a story. I wanted to be a concept artist, so I would spend a lot of time designing characters, ships and environments.
I didn't consider myself a writer back then, but I started getting ideas for a story. When I would draw environments or characters the ideas would just pop in my head. One scene led to another, then another etc. It took a lot of time, but the experience put in over the years not only helped the art, it also gave me time to develop the story more and give it more depth than it had in the earlier drafts.
Age Range: (PG - PG-13 )
- No sex or bad language
- No excessive gore. Girrion is primarily about a war so there is cartoon violence similar to the level of Star Wars, but more of it.
            This will be the first campaign where a full volume book is available. It will be 225+ pages in length. 6.14" x 9.2"
Volume 1 mockup. Cover art and design are in progress.
 Previous campaigns single issues were available in hardcover or softcover, and these formats will be available in this campaign as well. 
Sample Hardcover (Issue #7)
 Hardcover comic issues are 6" x 9". Grey cloth with a dust jacket. Each issue is anywhere from 22 - 26 pages in length.
Softcover samples (Issues 1-9)
Softcover comic issues are 6"x9" and have a glossy cover with a stock thicker than standard comics. The interior art is full color and has a watercolor feel.
Sample Character Sketch
  Sample 4" x 6" print
  How Do Add Ons Work?
Here's what you do:
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (blue button) Add the total of your Add On to your pledge amount. (i.e. one Giclee Fine art print is $25.) You don't need to change the tier you've selected You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey asking how you spent your add-on dollars and for other pertinent info. Thank you!
  Generally, about half of my expenses come from printing the books and mailing them. The other half of the budget is going into the production. Most of what this campaign money goes towards is large chunks of time for me to focus fully on the book. One issue takes me 300 - 400 hours. If I'm able to knock off some days working freelance on other jobs, the books come out much faster.
  Scout Comics is now publishing Girrion! They released Issue 1 last October and will be releasing books up through this Fall. They are an indie publisher– very supportive of their creators and just a great group of people all around. They also have a wide range of comics which you can check out on their site. www.scoutcomics.com
Follow
Website: www.girrion.com
Twitter: www.twitter.com/Girrion1
Instagram: www.instagram.com/girrion1/
Facebook: www.facebook.com/girrion1/
Music from Kickstarter Video: "Night Owl" by Broke For Free
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being that this is not the first comic I've made there aren't too many major challenges with getting the book made, but there are some small ones:

Some of the artwork on certain pages goes fast, some takes very long. There are some complex scenes in this issue with lots of characters and elements that need strong design. Again from past experience, the artwork can sometimes take a bit longer than expected. Also, keep in mind I have to mix this work in with the day job.

I've learned a lot from previous Kickstarter campaigns, and I am getting more and more efficient. I'm also trying to find ways to make rewards as cost-effective as possible too. One way of doing this is to do more than one issue per campaign, which cuts down on mailing costs. Before it took so long to complete just one issue and I could only offer one per campaign, but now I plan on doing 2 -3 issues per campaign from now on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Our Story
Imagine that every myth, ghost story, and monster were based on something that existed in the modern world. Magic was real. Strange artifacts that can perform miraculous events, including connecting our world to others and the gods that inhabit them, can be found. Or created.
This is the world of Horrors, Inc.
What if a few mega corporations, in cooperation with the governments of the world, kept it all from the general public? How could such a world-wide coverup exist with monsters and worse loose in the world? By those same companies employing the best minds to study the strange and weird. By enlisting the best soldiers(and killers) in the world to track the bizarre and dangerous down and "acquire" them. Regardless of the collateral damage.
Enter: Squad K
FACEBOOK                  TWITTER
But What is Horrors Inc: Squad K?
HISK is a suspenseful and darkly humorous series that follows a ragtag group of mercenaries tasked with hunting down monsters, breaking up cults, and acquiring magical artifacts for one of the world's mega-corporations, Soladyne Corp. Unfortunately, Soladyne is more interested in keeping the existence of these creatures secret and exploiting them for their own gain. The comic is a mix of horror, humor, and action blended together into a fun ride as we follow one of Soladyne's containment squads. The infamous Squad K.
Below is your first look at the squad. Besides these first sketches, I've decided NOT to do a break down of each character. Each member of Squad K has their own unique personalities, backstories, and flaws. Instead of giving you a break down of each, I'd rather have you learn about them organically from how they act in the comic series.
The Squad
The first season of HISK is an already outlined 12 issue run, divided up into 4 "missions" spread out over 3 issues each. 
Horrors, Inc: Squad K - Issues #1, 2, and 3 "The Jester", is the first three part story that jumps us right into one such mission to capture one of the worst kinds of monsters, A Horror. Horrors are your equivalent to Michael Myers, Jason Vorhees, and Freddy Kruger. Part ghost story, part mystical legend, and all unstoppable killing machine. Issue 1 opens on a ghost hunting team unwittingly stumbling across The Jester before Squad K arrives on the scene.

~44 Full-Colored Pages(Plus Interior of Cover and Back)

Thank You in the Back
All backers will be a part of regular updates that show off more of the story boarding process, uncolored pages, and then the finalized pages themselves.
Updates for ALL will include close to the first half of the comic before its complete during the campaign and then exclusively for BACKERS, the remaining pages afterwards. There will also be interactions between the author, artist, and backers as well.
Social Goals(explained below) could get you bumped up a tier for free!
First Page
All backers will receive a discount on all future issues (either through retail or another Kickstarter) as an extra thank you. Those backing at the Character in the Comics levels will receive the comic of their first (and for those dying, last) appearance for free.
The Creative Team
James R. Vernon(The Writer) is just your average guy that loves comics, video games, and movies. A long job commute got his creative juices flowing, and this SuperBacker grew into the author of the Bound to the Abyss fantasy series of novels(PDF, Print, and Audio versions) and the soon to be released Horrors, Inc. novel. Now, James is applying his creative talents to writing comic books as well.
               Twitter                    Author Facebook
 Dedy Koerniawan Soesanto is an illustrator and comic artist from Indonesia with basic autodidact and is on comic world now as he works and studies at Padepokan Ragasukma. He takes freelance work on DeviantArt under the name Dedyk.
His first comic, Nagasari is an action fantasy silat comic. You can read the preview atragasukma.com.
His other credits include being a color artist on H2o Reborn at kolamkomik.com, working on the story and art for horror comic Sinawang at ciayo.com and has his own comic project coming soon.
The Storyboarding Process, Page 8 and 9
The Costs
We believe in complete transparency and want to build a great relationship with our new audience, so I've included the breakdown of everything below. These are our best estimates from speaking with other creators, printers, and backers. (Feel free to imagine it in a big, fancy pie chart!)
~$450 - 10% to Kickstarter and Processing Fees
~$2000 - to Dedy for the remaining comic pages including interior and  exterior of the covers
~$1700 - to print 400 copies of comic and ship them to me for redistribution
~$500 - Packaging and Shipping of Comics and Rewards
~$350 - production of comic sleeves, backs, bookmarks, and posters
~$400 - to Dedy for Promotional Art and Other Rewards
TOTAL: ~$5,350
BUT WAIT(you may say)! THAT ADDS UP TO MORE THAN YOU'RE HOPING TO RAISE! WILL YOU NEED MORE MONEY THEN YOU ARE ASKING?
ANSWER: ABSOLUTELY NOT!
I've put a good chunk in my own money to get the ball rolling with Dedy to produce the finished pages and all of the other artwork you'll see in the updates. I believe in this project and want to show that I'm not looking for my backers to foot the entire bill.
The money being asked for is to make sure we get everything finished in a timely manner, produce enough comics for our potential backers and for trade shows and whole sale, and provide the rewards to all of you!
Page 8 Finished
  Why Kickstarter?
Kickstarter has become a leading source for independent creators to get their work out into the world while building a fan base from the ground up. In our case, starting a brand new comic story is as daunting as it is expensive. Having our Kickstarter campaign funded allows us to;
Keep Creative Control
Provide an excellent avenue to keep in touch with other creative types and our potential fans
Create a direct route to market and sell the comic on completion
Rewards:
All Backers - Everyone that backs the project will have access to updates, sketches, and interactions with the author and artist. All backers names will also be placed on a special page in thank you at the back of the first issue. Each backer will also receive a discount on future issues (both retail versions and future Kickstarters.)
Bookmarks - All backers at the $10 level and up get a bookmark to mark their place.
PDF and/or Physical Comic - The PDF and Comic are 44 hand-crafted and colored pages of goodness. The extended comic includes pages of work from sketches and inks to cover ideas.
Cover
INDIE SUPPORT GROUP - All backers at this level will get a special mention in each Friday update for this project. This can include blurbs about your Kickstarter project(upcoming, current, or already successful) or links to your work elsewhere. Special mention if you're also a project I've backed!
This is just my way of further supporting some of the amazing creative talents I've seen and backed on this sight as well as others that are trying to make it on their own and with the support of the community.
6" x 8" Head Sketch - A signed 6" by 8" sketch of a character of your choice, signed by Dedy.
Choose One!
Poster - An 11" by 17" unique poster for the comic by Dedy.
Poster
The Novel - Horrors, Inc. is a sci-fi horror novel set around the end of the comic's first season. The story follows Eddie Watson, a simple, low-level janitor working at one of the most advanced pharmaceutical and tech companies in the world, Soladyne Tech. After a chance encounter with high ranking company employee Joseph Hinderlight, Eddie finds himself dragged into a fight for his life. The company comes under attack from forces that Eddie can't quite explain, but don't seem to shock the resolute Hinderlight. As they move deeper into complex where Eddie works, the company's darker secrets are revealed as the two meet others trying to survive. Can they escape the increasingly horrific monsters that now roam the building.
Horrors, Inc. Novel
  Becoming a Character - Like Dedy's art style? How would you like to see yourself as one of his characters? A pledge at the $75 tier gets you a professionally done character sheet of you! Even better, how would you like to be IN a future comic? Besides the character sheet you could see your comic self either, killed off at the $100 tier in a future comic or survive to appear in multiple issues as a background character at the $150 tier.

As we approach this goal, I'll start giving out more info on what you can expect to see next. All backers will ALSO receive versions of these issues that mirror their rewards for the first comic.

Nothing helps a Kickstarter more than word of mouth. A fun way to assist with that is to provide rewards for reaching certain social goals. The goals and rewards that you can help achieve are listed below!

campaign.story:
WE'RE BACK!
GRIFF GRISTLE: The Siren's Song... 
Storming back into port, from the writing duo of Rob Jones and Mike Sambrook (Griff Gristle, Papercuts and Inkstains, Tragic Tales of Horrere), Cornish based artist Rory Donald, aka Reach Illustration (Griff Gristle, Resurrection Men, Papercuts and Inkstains, Pigs Might Surf) and designer Brad Holman (Madius Comics alumni) comes Griff Gristle: The Siren's Song, the follow up to the critically acclaimed and successfully Kickstarted Here Be Monsters.
GRIFF GRISTLE: THE SIREN'S SONG is a 48 page supernatural adventure comic with a punk rock heart that takes the tropes of the horror and supernatural genres and puts them all at sea…
MIKE AND ROB: Mike Sambrook and Rob Jones have been wrestling their way, arse first, into comics for the past two years and would like to think they finally have a grasp on things... Their work can be found in Papercuts and Inkstains, Tragic Tales of Horrere, Ramlock Investigates, and The Kings Leap. You can find them attached at the hip on twitter here and here.
RORY DONALD: Is most certainly not just a drawing. Rory is an artist based in the beautiful Cornish coastline and has had the misfortune of working with Rob and Mike before. Needless to say, the mind control device worked and he is lumbered with working with them again. You can find Rory's work in Papercuts and Inkstains 2, Fly Comics and Pigs Might Surf.
You can find Rory on the twitter here.
Griff Gristle is our only protection from the nightmares of the deep and it seems as though the nightmares are rising. Griff, vulnerable after the recent loss of his wife and in unchartered territory with a newly found acquaintance, is trying to unravel the increasing intensity of unexplained maritime occurrences in the area. Missing boats, unsettled spirits, underwater churches and impromptu exorcisms were just the tip of the iceberg and you won’t believe what’s coming next. After putting an end to the occurrences in Charlsberg, Griff and Justine have followed a lead to a cruise ship that is carrying some unauthorised and highly concerning cargo. Buckle your seatbelt for rough waters, it’s time to hear THE SIREN’S SONG!
Who are the children of the waves and what do they want?
The Siren's Song also features a seven page Epilogue entitled Awakenings which gives readers more insight into the Children of the Waves and just what it is they want with our eponymous hero.
Don’t worry if you’re a brand new reader as care has been taken to make the issue as new reader friendly as possible and everything you need to know will be explained in the book. So if you want to jump right in with issue 2, you can!

£25 - THE ADMIRAL'S BUNDLE The 48 page full colour comic, a set of 5 A6 Griff Tarot Cards drawn by series artist Rory Donald, a Griff enamel badge, a set of 4 A4 prints by our guest artists AND the POSEIDON Tour Tee in your size! You'll also receive the digital comic file, DRM free.
£30 - THE TRADESMAN BUNDLE Own a comic shop? Then you get 10x physical copies of GRIFF GRISTLE: THE SIREN'S SONG! Plus a set of art prints too. Rob & Mike (and depending on location, Rory too) are also happy to organise with you some signings in UK stores.
£85 - ORIGINAL ART - HERE BE MONSTERS We have managed to prise some of Rory's original pencilled pages from his tight clutches and are offering them up to you! You get everything in the ADMIRAL'S BUNDLE tier AND a gloriously penciled page from Griff Gristle #1. We'll package it up safe and sound for you and ensure it's delivered to your door/cabin/post box (delete applicable!) Includes free UK delivery
£85 - ORIGINAL ART - THE SIREN'S SONG We have managed to prise some of Rory's original pencilled pages from his tight clutches and are offering them up to you! You get everything in the ADMIRAL'S BUNDLE tier AND a gloriously blue penciled page from Griff Gristle #2. We'll package it up safe and sound for you and ensure it's delivered to your door/cabin/post box (delete applicable!) Includes free UK delivery
£100 - ORIGINAL ART - GRANT RICHARDS GET YOUR HANDS ON THE ORIGINAL ART FOR GRANT RICHARD'S BRILLIANT PIN UP! You get everything in the ADMIRAL'S BUNDLE tier AND the beautifully inked pinup of Griff from Grant. We'll package it up safe and sound for you and ensure it's delivered to your door/cabin/post box (delete applicable!) Includes free UK delivery
£120 - COVER ART SPECTACULAR GET YOUR HANDS ON THE ORIGINAL ARTWORK FOR RORY'S INCREDIBLE SIREN'S SONG COVER! You get everything in the ADMIRAL'S BUNDLE tier AND the beautifully drawn cover featuring Griff, Justine and the Siren from Rory. We'll package it up safe and sound for you and ensure it's delivered to your door/cabin/post box (delete applicable!) Includes free UK delivery

Nick Brokenshire

Robert Carey

The Cover Inks
  This is our third Kickstarter now, hot on the heels of the collected Paperbacks and Inkstains. We use Kickstarter because it enables us to deliver a whole host of products which we otherwise wouldn't be able to fund in association with our titles, such as tees and badges. 
We feel a Kickstarter will give us a great opportunity to deliver a bigger, broader scoped story to those who are already familiar with our work and also open up the opportunity for those who aren't familiar with us to get in on a project that we feel is some of our best work.
We continue to want to treat each and every one of you like a good friend, Hell...you're realising our dreams by backing this, so expect to be on our Christmas card list. We will do our utmost to ensure that the experience you get from backing us is a positive ride of ghost-less proportions. We're proud to put our names to this, we're proud of the work that every individual has put into this comic and especially proud to receive the backing of you fine ladies and gents.

The comic artwork is completely finished, it's lettered, edited, PDF'd and PRETTY DAMN FINE! It's all polished and ready to be printed, all we need is the backing of sexy individuals such as you!

The campaign is to fund a decent payment for Mr Donald, for his spectacular art skills, and for us to fund the production and printing of this book and its subsequent packaging and delivering to you. If we have some left over, then that will be put towards creating issue three!

We use UK based printers, Comic Printing UK, to make the process of us getting the books in our hands as speedy and efficient as possible, plus, they're the best printers we know...we'd only want the best for you! Except you, Beaufort...you know what you did...

campaign.story:
We're funded!! Thank you all so very much!
Let's keep it going for the next 24 hours!
Story
"What if you could be invisible? Would you remain moral? What if you were never moral to begin with?"
A fusion of a classic Invisible Man tale and a crime thriller, steeped in Sci-Fi influence. Thomas Taylor is a successful cat burglar, until he isn't...
Set in an approximation of London in the not too distant future, our hero(?) is a cat burglar with a heart of gold, diamonds, art, or anything else that takes his fancy. While stealing a rare stone for his “patron”, Lord Chaundry, a bribed security guard goes turncoat and Taylor’s head ends up on the wrong side of a truncheon. 
Bailed by his boss, Taylor now owes him, and Chaundry has no ethical qualms about experimenting on the thief, using the talents of the vicious nanobot engineer (and psychopath) Dr. Mann to (painfully) render him invisible.
Mission
I’ve been obsessed with science fiction since I was a little kid devouring Star Trek and reruns of old shows on terrestrial television in Ireland. One of those shows was the old British version of the Invisible Man. Irish TV in the early 90s was bursting with reruns of 50s, 60s and 70s shows. I remember watching, frozen in terror, as the invisible man unraveled his bandages.
I’ve wanted to see an Invisible man story told with a bit of humour and with a more modern bend. There’s an old adage about a little red hen, who just does it herself. With this in mind, I set about writing Out of Sight. Futurism in sci-fi has always left me spellbound, and so I wanted to incorporate future science into the story. Nanotechnology is at the forefront of future tech that always seems to be right around the corner, and its possibilities are endless. Imagine nanobots that can embed themselves in your cells and refract the light around you, leaving you invisible to the naked eye. Unscientific? Perhaps. Exciting? Very.
If you’re mesmerised by the possibilities of science and what the future holds, if you like smart-ass anti-heroes, self-referential humour, heist movies, and shady oligarchical conspiracies, then please support our upcoming Kickstarter and help us make this comic a reality!
Why Kickstart Out of Sight?
Too often artists are working on comics completely unpaid. I don't have the resources to pay for a full comic and I don't want to ask artists to work for free. Both of these artists have a lot of work under their belts, so I know they can deliver the goods. By Kickstarting Out of Sight you will help pay the artists, and help publish a cool comic! 
As featured on:
Preview
        Team
Nenad Cviticanin - Art & Lettering
https://www.facebook.com/theartofnenadcviticanin/
Nenad is a talented artist who comes from Serbia. His previous work includes: Best Friend (ComicCollabs Blind Date winner), Slate (2016) Nightmare warriors, # 1 and # 2, 5 titles (around 22-25 pages per issue) for Approbation comics, Grief by Frank Gogol, Hell on my couch # 6 and # 7, Fringe science # 1, and many many other short comics.
Joe Griffin - Colouring
https://www.facebook.com/josephgriffinartist/
Joseph Griffin is a colourist and illustrator based in Cork, Ireland. He has had work published with Turncoat Press, Lightning Strike and others. He also wrote an amazing webcomic about Howard Hughes called "The Adventures of Howard Hughes". Damned Peas!
Patrick Hammond - Story
https://www.twitter.com/paddywords 
I write stories, songs and poems, and I love comics most of all. My previous work includes: Best Friend (ComicCollabs Blind Date winner) and Star Jump, a webcomic. My day job is also in writing, so I'm used to constant deadlines!
Rewards explained
Art thief
With this bundle you will receive six heavyweight prints of pages from the comic, including the cover!
The accomplice
We sketch you in the middle of a heist with Taylor, presumably getting away with all the loot! 
Stealing the limelight
You get to be in the comic! We'll draw you as an onlooker in the background of one of the most important panels in the comic!
Cost Breakdown
I will be personally paying for tier printing, and any other costs associated with the project.

Hi all,
Thank you! Merci! Dank Je Wel! Gracias! Go raibh míle maith agat!
At this stage you should have received, or be about to receive your package.
You will note the tape and the weird brievenbusdoos; an invention of which I do not even know the equivalent English word. This should keep your packages safe and allow them to be delivered through your mailbox :)

Hi everyone,
Well after a few little issues, our comics are printed! It is very cool seeing this in the flesh for the first time.
I am now bagging and boarding each copy and preparing the tier rewards for printing.
I'll be getting those printed at the start of next week, with a view to begin shipping out in the following week.

Hello everyone,
Happy New Year to all of our backers. Thank you for making 2017 a great one.
The files are sent to the printer and I've received proofs. Now it's a matter of getting them printed and out to you all. Depending on the length of time it takes to print, deliver to me, package, and deliver to you, you should be receiving your print copy of Out of Sight in late January. For folks who are outside of Europe it might take a little bit longer, but I'll be keeping you up to date as printing progresses.

Hi all,
We are so close to release now. Just finishing up the making of Out of Sight and some last minute edits.
I am really happy with how this has come together. It looks beautiful, thanks to Joe and Nenad, and I still like the story. That's a rarity this far into the process.
We've been busily working to bring Out of Sight to life. We're currently only a few pages away from completion of the comic proper. To tease you thoroughly, check out this fantastic Art from Nenad!

Hi All,
Just an update to say the artists have been paid for the first 5 pages. Thanks to your pledges, these lads got some cash for their hard work. 
This whole Kickstarter was dreamt up with this goal in mind, so it was extremely satisfying to fulfil it. I wanted to share that satisfaction with you.

To our backers,
In the next week I'll be completing a final edit of pages 6-22 of Out of Sight. 
From there I'll send the final script to the lads, so they can work their artistic magic. 
I will also be sending out surveys for shipping information, and any other required information (e.g. photos for the top reward tier)

Thank you all so very much.
I am so happy to say we made our target, and now we can begin producing Out of Sight.
I'll be updating as we produce the comic, I'll keep in touch every step of the way. 
For this evening, I'll just sit back and relax, finally.

campaign.story:
On lonely highways, giants lurk along roads and ghosts linger in rest stops. A deadly fire meets its grave in the green bay, and an earthquake crushes a home found in San Francisco. A daughter reclaims her father's old victory, while another journeys to Tepoztlán, thinking about her Mexican heritage and stumbling across something divine. Forgotten shores and talk of the legendary snake mountain, voices from the past and oceans in the sky... 
Growing up, we absorb tons of shared stories from where we live. Urban legends, fables, and folktales morph over time, yet are defined by their determination to insert the fantastic into the mundane. This anthology has collected a new set of lore, told by the indie creators of today.
“The Sun and the Wayward Wind” is a full-color comics and illustration anthology, brought to you as an 192 page, 7.5”x10” softcover book. A line-up of sixteen comic teams and nine illustrators have come together to create new work that tells their own legend from North America. These creators bring you tales from the Arctic circle to Oaxaca, both historical and contemporary.
The next step is to raise the money to pay for printing, shipping, and paying our contributors. We are an independent publisher, and so are not affiliated with any larger publishing house or company. Here is the breakdown of our budget:
We hope you will join us in this new journey! Park the car, gather around the campfire, and let's tell some stories.

We will always do our best through Kickstarter updates to keep you as informed as possible as to the status of your game(s). However, in this business, some uncertain and ever-changing factors are beyond our control, such as holidays, customs, quality control, inspection delays, inclement weather and dock strikes - to name a few. As you can imagine, we have little to no control over such factors. We assure you that you will be the first to know any developments as we learn them.
 
To put it simply, you will get everything we promise to you when you pledge to one of our Kickstarter projects, and it will be delivered to you in as timely a manner as possible.
 
We ship your game(s) to you via various fulfillment partners located around the world. We do this to keep expenses as low as possible and hope that you will see this change reflected in the shipping costs for our projects.
 
We reserve the right to combine the shipping of any and all pledges for multiple projects if the shipping runs close to the same time and we can ship them all within a reasonable time frame (30 days) of us receiving them. We will advise you as soon as possible if it looks like we will delay shipping for this reason. You will always have the right to pay additional fees to get expedited delivery on orders. 
 
Shipping issues are relatively uncommon, but they do sometimes occur. We double check all of your games for damage before sending them to you. However, there is a small chance that your games may get damaged during shipping by the carrier. If your package is damaged, please contact us so we can assist you.
 
We will not ship to Russia, the Ukraine and certain places in Asia and the rest of the world, except for specially-made arrangements wherein the Backer takes the risk involved in receiving the package.

Kingdom Death: Monster 1.5
Kingdom Death Monster is an massive cooperative board game about survival in a nightmare-horror world. Survivors fight for their lives against an onslaught of bizarre and fearsome creatures. They will use the fruits of these battles to build a fragile civilization in a place where humans are at the bottom of a monstrous ecology. 
Initially, I brought the concept for Monster to Kickstarter in order to make a far-away dream into a reality. The runaway train of success helped pack the game with more original art, in-depth gameplay, and fantastically sculpted minis than even I dreamed of. A game this size could not feasibly be made without the community of supportive backers we found on Kickstarter. It's too expensive to produce and too vivid for distribution.
Through the experience of kickstarting Monster, I found a group of people that shares my vision for a blisteringly difficult game with a continually emerging story. I am truly humbled to share it with the world.
Now there isn't a single factory sealed copy at KD HQ. There are still people asking if there will ever be more so I'm back on Kickstarter to launch a campaign for a new edition. I want to print updated rules, great new expansions, even more content and (with your help) many surprises!!!
Kingdom Death: Monster 1.5 Changelog

In the First Hero Expansion, players take the role of 4 veteran survivors who have no settlement to call their own. They find and invade a settlement where they face the First Hero, a survivor so powerful, they do all the hunting by themselves! The purpose of this expansion is to help players start more advanced campaigns at Lantern Year 12 or 20. Instead of simply providing complicated rules to generate later settlements, your showdown with the First Hero will create the advanced settlement that you can take over.

Shipping Details & Shipping Waves
One thing we've learned from managing the impossibly huge number of reward combinations from our first campaign is to strike a balance between timely delivery of rewards to our eager fans and being logistically responsible to our staff and partners. So here's what we've decided about shipping rewards for this campaign.

We have set the estimated delivery of all pledge levels to December 2020. This is a best case scenario, in case our campaign gets insanley huge! 3-4 years development, production & transportation cycle to 100% finish every promise we might make during this campaign is realistic.  
Rewards from this Kickstarter will ship in waves that will be determined by the final scope of this campaign. Each wave's shipping costs will be collected through a pledge manager (most likely backerkit) when the goods are ready to ship. Shipping costs will reflect the actual cost to ship your pledge and any additional rewards you selected from that wave.
Like our previous campaign, we will make our best efforts to ease the burden of shipping by fulfilling rewards from shipping partners around the world (projected as: US, CA, EU, AU.)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I learned a lot about manufacturing a top-quality boutique game and fulfilling it to our backers from our first Kickstarter. Not all my lessons were easy, but all of them were meaningful. Trying to bring such a staggeringly large game to life, we worked insane hours, fought lots of battles, and saw some unexpected setbacks. It's taught me how to look for ways to turn logistical, artistic, and fiscal difficulties into assets.


I'm heading into this campaign with my eyes open. If this campaign meets with success we'll be on the hook to you guys for loads more quality content. The bigger we get, the more complex fulfillment will become. I will create a transparent, streamlined campaign from the outset and work hard to maintain the honest communication about our process and developments to make sure we meet everyone's expectations. We'll be pushing even harder to bring you the best of our vision without compromise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Sacred Backer Time #6 - Project delay for a Week
updates.update_content:
Welcome to our 5th Sacred Backer Time update. This update wont have any major bells and whistles, massive images, or anyone copy editing it.
The Watertable in NYC is very high right now. We’ve had crazy downpour almost everyday and the toilet in our new basement decided it had enough and vomited everywhere. I guess my emergency fix involving zip ties and a Poland spring gallon bottle cut to be a pipe patch is only holding out for so long. A professional is coming later today, hopefully they can sort it out. (While I yell at them from 20 feet away!)

Welcome to our 5th Sacred Backer Time update. This update wont have any major bells and whistles, massive images or anyone copy editing it.
NYC is on phase 3 of reopening and is looking towards phase 4. Far as we are concerned here, pretty much all public indoor activity is canceled. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1. Because of the mass manufacturing techniques we employ to keep StandiT affordable, we have minimum order quantities of 250 units to launch production. If we don't reach our funding goal we won't be able to launch production. Hopefully, that’s not a problem!

2. Each StandiT leg is a complex mechatronic actuator. We want to ensure quality in each and every one of our products so we perform testing on every unit before shipping. Although more costly, we believe in ensuring the absolute best for our customers.

3. Each StandiT component is made of dozens of parts which come from different suppliers. As with any other hardware products, suppliers may deliver later or not at all, leaving us in a bad situation. To remedy that, we have sourced each component from at least two suppliers, so that if one can't do the job, we can easily switch to the other and reduce delays.

4. Because of the size and weight of a piece of furniture, shipping can be expensive. Thanks to our easy modular design and assembly process, we have reduced packaging to its minimum, making it easier than ever to ship and receive. Furthermore, we have already partnered with one of the largest shipping companies, so we can take good care of our product and ship quickly to your door.

Touching Evil Volume One: The Curse Escapes is a 240 page hardcover graphic novel following a woman cursed with the ability to kill anyone she touches, but only if they're evil.
  "Dougherty's vision is cinematic. It's Breaking Bad meets The Twilight Zone. I want this on my TV immediately."   -   Dan Fogler, actor
"Touching Evil is complete and complex. It is the 'enveloping dream' that the late novelist and fiction guru John Gardner said a story must be." -    Mort Castle, author
"Never before in comic book form have the complex relationships - and ramifications - of the concepts of 'good' and 'evil' been so masterfully explored as they are in pages of Touching Evil. This compelling and powerful series blends mystery, action, drama, and horror into a thought-provoking morality tale that poses many unsettling questions about the values we hold ourselves - and others - to each and every day. "              -    Dirk Manning, author, Cthulhu's homeboy
"An ancient curse. A creepy prison. Innovative, beautifully written and well-drawn."    -  James VanOsdol, radio personality
THE PITCH
Ada Mansfield is an ordinary woman who has been given an extraordinary curse. She can kill anyone she touches, but only if they're evil. She doesn't know WHO is evil until it's too late, and she doesn't WANT to use the curse but her power attracts those who would do anything - even evil things - to take it from her. 
Mockup of the book with art by Tom Kelly
Ada goes from being an uncaring criminal lawyer to becoming a supernatural judge, jury and executioner. As she navigates the dangers of her new powers she is protective of the people who matter most to her, and fearful of whether she knows them well enough to know what her curse would do to them.
But don't just take my word for it, download and read the first issue for FREE by clicking this link here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/49gdh3z1dwjmb7h/Touching%20Evil%201%20PDF%20Comixology.pdf?dl=0
Why Kickstarter?
This has been a labor of love since I began in 2013. I'm happy to say that I've been able to realize my story with a combination of my own funds and hard work and the support of the fans. Now that this first story arc is complete, I want to take Touching Evil to a new level and I need KICKSTARTER and YOU for that. Creating a print run of (approximately) 2,000 copies of this hardcover will mean that YOU get the best presentation of the book, and I can bring that presentation to the masses as I embark on a book tour in 2016 that will take Touching Evil to 20+ appearances at comic conventions and stores. By increasing the fan base and profile of Touching Evil, it allows me to continue making this creator-owned independent book.
STRETCH GOALS! I am super excited about this, check it out!
  REWARDS!
T-SHIRTS ARE EVIL!
FLOPPY COPIES ARE EVIL!
ARTISTS ARE EVIL!
SKETCH COVERS ARE EVIL!
DAN DOUGHERTY IS EVIL!
BEARDO IS EVIL!
 YOU ARE EVIL!

I've successfully self-published this whole series as well as all four volumes of my Beardo series, and have been a part of or facilitated over three dozen books that have gone to print. I'm saying: I got this.

The hardest part is creating the content, and that is already done. The money I'm asking for finances the production of the book. campaign.story:
"Magnificent" is 100% funded! But we have some awesome stretch goals - all of which will give more perks and rewards right back to our backers! Anything we raise now is NOT for us - it's to print "Magnificent" with as many features as possible to give all of our backers the most bang for their buck!
$6500 - Premium Format & Bonus Features!
Now, "Magnificent" will be printed with a BONUS 14 pages of behind-the-scenes materials - think the DVD extras! Featuring sketches, designs, scripts and more. PLUS, the book will have premium spot gloss on the cover! EVERY BACKER getting a copy of the book will now get this deluxe edition!
$8000 - Free Comic Book Day Prequel!
If we hit $8000, we will print a Free Comic Book Day prequel to "Magnificent" featuring NEW STORY not in the original comic. This is not a preview of story you're already getting - it's new material never before seen! Every backer pledging $5 or more will get a copy of this preview with their rewards!
$9500 - Hardcovers with a Heart!
If we hit $9500, every copy of "Magnificent" will be a hardcover! Even though the cover price will now be $14.99, EVERY BACKER who gets a copy of the book will be getting the hardcover! PLUS, once the book is publicly available we will donate 5% of the net sales of every copy to The Port Ministries, a charity that provides food, daycare, healthcare, and more to the Back Of The Yards community of Chicago.
Thanks for helping us get this far - now let's see how high we can reach! Remember, all of these stretch goals will benefit our backers - the money we raise now will go right back to you!
Who Is The Magnificent?
The first graphic novel by Chimera’s Comics, "Magnificent" is an original 66-page paperback by Carmelo Chimera, Steven Brown, and David Gonzalez. "Magnificent" is a story about the pains of growing up and staying true to yourself no matter what life throws you.
The Story
Have you ever had your heart broken? Do you remember the first time you felt pride in a talent? When was the last time you fell flat on your face or screwed up so badly you thought the world would end?
Even though Adam is a super-hero, all of this happened to him too. He was called The Magnificent, but that was before. Before he was captured, tortured, and experimented on. Over his life he learned the same lessons we all do – how to love, how to fail, and how to persevere.
And when Adam discovers he’s more powerful than he ever imagined, everything he’s learned comes together to answer life’s greatest question: are we shaped by the cynicism of a cruel world, or can we choose who we want to be no matter what?
The Characters
Adam Garfield is The Magnificent. His naivety will make him vulnerable to attack from all sides. Whether its a neglected girlfriend, a jealous military leader, or a psychopath looking for a fight, the world seems resolved to make his naive mission a trial by fire. Adam will go through pain and failure beyond description before discovering his true power. And when he does, Adam will have to prove if he’s a true hero…by being true to himself.
Pencilled Artwork In Progress
Maxwell Edison has a problem: What do you get for the man who has everything?  With the ability to control electromagnetism, there is no challenge left in the world for Maxwell. That is, until he sees The Magnificent picking up buildings on TV. Maxwell was on the first plane out from the UK to meet the young hero and, hopefully, find the fight of his life. Maxwell’s masochistic and hedonistic mentality is the perfect foil for the Magnificent’s selflessness. Unlike the young hero, Maxwell believes power is meant to be used. 
Pencilled and Inked Artwork In Progress.
The General is the mysterious leader of Blackstone, a paramilitary group that has imprisoned The Magnificent. The General sees The Magnificent as his own son, and believes he must teach this child that life is pain. But as the years roll on, the young hero’s refusal to compromise challenges everything the cynical General believes about the world.
Inked Artwork in progress.
The Dream 
6 years ago, Carmelo Chimera wrote an original graphic novel. Partnering with his long-time friend Steven Brown, the duo worked closer than ever to create “Magnificent.”
While working on the comic book, Steven and Carmelo got sidetracked by opening Chimera’s Comics. Their first store opened in La Grange, Illinois in 2011 and they’ve since opened two more stores and are starting an online store as we speak.
Chimera's Comics Third Location in Woodridge
Running Chimera’s Comics taught Steven and Carmelo more about making and selling comics than they ever thought possible, and introduced them to their newest collaborator David “Hommy” Gonzalez. Hommy is a graphic designed and marketing consultant for Chimera’s Comics by night, and the Interim Executive Director of The Port Ministries by day.
Chimera’s Comics was designed to me be more than just a store. With weekly gaming tournaments, special events like 24 Hour Comics Day, professional guests and more, Chimera’s Comics has become a community. That’s why it’s so fitting that we’re asking our community to come together to help make our dream for “Magnificent” a reality. This is how we come full circle. You’ve brought us this far, and we try to thank you by giving you the best comic book store we can. Now we want to thank you by giving you the best comic we can.
The Creators
Meet the creative team! Art by Claire Faulkner.
Carmelo Chimera was born on Krypton, but when he came to Earth he grew up in the suburbs of Chicago. He wrote “Magnificent” while studying at Carthage College, and even after law school at the University of Chicago Carmelo was still a big enough nerd to open Chimera’s Comics with Steven Brown. Three stores later, the duo has returned to finish what they started and reveal “Magnificent” to the world.
Steven Brown, like most artists, get his inspiration from his misunderstood and tortured soul. While attending the American Academy of Art in Chicago, Steven cultivated such past times as brooding, acting incredulous, and showing disdain for basic human emotion. He’s put his talents to use as a professional storyboard artist and is the co-founder and true mastermind of Chimera’s Comics. He is also the co-host of the store’s podcast, Caffeinated Comics. In spite of everything, he is universally well-liked and widely regarded as “fun to be around.”
David Gonzalez has yet to be reached for comment. When we called him to complete this interview, we were routed through a complex system of teleprompts before we gave up and drove to his office at The Port Ministries. Though we can’t be sure, we think we saw him running out the back and down the block while we were knocking on the front door of his office. He continues to upload inked and colored artwork into our Dropbox though, so that’s something.
The Budget
See how we'll use your support to bring "Magnificent" to life
A breakdown of the expenses involved.
The Timeline
An outline of our projected deadlines to complete the project
The Production
For the production, we've turned to one of the most trusted names in comic printing, PrintNinja. Local to Evanston, Illinois, PrintNinja has both the quality of workmanship and the brand reputation to bring our project to life.
The Setting
"Magnificent" is a Chicago-centric story. The titular hero is named for the famous Magnificent Mile, and his enemies are also named for famous Chicago streets. The story itself takes place in Chicago - from the playgrounds of the suburbs to the rooftops of the Loop's skyscrapers.  It's fitting that a story about growing up take place in the city where the creators grew up.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The hardest part about completing "Magnificent" is the same issue we've had for 6 years. Life happens, and we have deferred this dream over and over again. Not without good reason - we've opened three comic book stores, Carmelo became a lawyer, and David spends 12 hours a day turning The Port Ministries into the best charity it can be. Delays involved in the creative process and printing/shipping logistics are also possible.

However, over the last four years Chimera's Comics has not only survived, but thrived. Everything we have put our minds to has come true. With our business experience, we know how to create a plan and stick to it. We are ready to make this project our number one priority, as we once did with our stores. We're working to minimize risks by working with reputable printers, and using our established industry and distributor contacts.

As with everything we have done, there are no challenges we cannot overcome when a community like this one unites behind us.

campaign.story:
THE STORY...
The world of superheroes has always been very black and white. Killing is bad, arresting villains is good, the law must be upheld, the people must be protected.  But what happens when superheroes are forced to live in shades of gray?
DAS Group is an action comic book (with a bit of a darker sense of humor) that explores a world conquered by the savage super humans known as Defects.  In this world only one place remains a safe haven for mankind, Victory City.  But in this case, safe is a relative term.  The city is ruled by Victor, who aside from being a big enough narcissist to name an entire city after himself, was the self appointed overlord of the criminal underworld prior to the defects assault on mankind. Viewing Victors reign as a necessary evil, a small group of defects living in Victory city accepted his "request" that they aid him in maintaining control.  And so, DAS Group was formed. 
But after years of serving what Victor calls "the greater good", and with a defect invasion on their doorstep, choices must be made.  Can DAS Group break the city free of Victors grasp without plunging it into chaos?  Or should his reign be allowed to continue for the sake of the greater good?  And above all else, how far can our team of superheroes go before they become the villains? Every decision has steep consequences, and sacrifices must be made. There cant always be a happy ending.
Page 11.

THE PROJECT...
The project is pretty simple, DAS Group is going to be a 24 page full color comic book. As you read this I am slaving away in my dungeon to pencil, ink, and color every single page of this masterpiece.  However, without a little help we will never be able to afford the publishing costs. To fund our first round of printing, we will need to raise at least $1000. This will allow us to print 500 copies of DAS Group issue #1, and assist with the cost of shipping each and every one of you your awesome rewards! Even at $1000 we are still going to be covering part of the printing costs ourselves so its important this kickstarter is a success.
HOW ABOUT A PEEK?
Now that we are done discussing business, take a moment and enjoy some artwork from DAS Group.
AND DONT FORGET...
For just $50 you earn one of the original ONE OF A KIND ink pages used to create DAS Group! These pages will never be available again, so get them while you can.
NOW, LETS DISCUSS THE FUTURE...
After reading the summary of our story you're probably thinking it is way too big to do justice in just 24 pages. Well, we couldn't agree more. Our goal is to tell the story over a minimum of 6 issues. That means over the life of this endeavor, we are facing over $7000 in printing fees alone, not to mention supplies, shipping costs, and advertising. So we are going to give you guys a little incentive to help us get as close to our stretch goals as possible.
IF WE RAISE $2,000...
The comic book will be printed with 4 additional pages of concept art. 
All print copies shipped to backers will be signed by the entire DAS Group creative team.

campaign.story:
Spread the word! Follow us on Twitter @outerlandsdoc. Like our Facebook Page. Follow the Outerlands tumblr and Pinterest!
FINAL HOURS -- FUNDED! BUT IT'S NOT TOO LATE FOR STRETCH GOALS!
Over 40% of our referrals have come from Twitter, so whether you've backed the project or not, get out there and tweet the link http://bit.ly/outerlands and tag it with #BackOuterlands! We COULD get to a fully 100% original-music soundtrack!
------------------------------------------------------------
Watch our Kickstarter video In Full 1080p HD!
From the creators of The 1UP Show, CO-OP, I Am Street Fighter, and GROUNDED: Making The Last of Us.
NEW OUTERLANDS DOUBLE-ECLIPSE POSTER! (2/7/14)!
We're very, very happy to introduce a new poster option designed by FEZ creator Phil Fish! It'll be a high-quality print on a delicately textured surface with glossy, smooth-finished text. There's a new tier over to the right at the same cost as the existing poster tier. We won't have the other poster design until after the Kickstarter campaign is over, but don't worry! We'll be sending out a backer's poll after both designs have gone out and you can choose then which design you'd like.
NEW OUTERLANDS SHORT (1/29/14)!
Here's a taste of what Outerlands will be like. We'll have another short ready for you before the Kickstarter campaign is over. Thank you for your support!
FIVE NEW DIGITAL TIERS (2/5/14)!
Our fantastic music collaborators Jim Guthrie and Disasterpeace have offered up some INCREDIBLE music bundles for our backers! We've got new options at $45, $50, $70, $100, and $135. You can get entire bundles of music at each of those tiers, but the $70 tier is an extremely limited (10 ONLY) offering where Jim will personally sign and send you a vinyl of Sword & Sworcery LP - The Ballad of the Space Babies. If you haven't heard the S&S music or seen the artwork before, they're both incredbly impressive!
WHAT IS OUTERLANDS?
A DOCUMENTARY "TV SERIES" ... Even though this isn't for a TV network, we're calling it a "TV series" because of the format. It'll be a minimum of six one-hour episodes. A TV "one hour" can mean anything from 42 to 60 minutes.
IN SIX EPISODES ... We could potentially do more than six if we reach some of our stretch goals!
ABOUT THE PEOPLE AND CULTURE OF VIDEOGAMES ... Videogames are art. Art is culture. Within any culture are beautiful traditions, heartfelt passions, and incredible, unbelievable stories to be told. That's where Outerlands comes in.
THAT CAN'T BE MADE ANY OTHER WAY. Traditional media outlets, broadcast networks, and even the new wave of original content from online distribution aren't going to take a "risk" on videogame content. We don't think it is a risk. We think videogames are a global cultural revolution that's sweeping in whole new ways of looking at the world, inspiring countless people into new lives, and that untold numbers are aching for this kind of content. Help us prove it!
WHY $210,000?
Video is expensive—especially documentary content that requires ongoing access over a long period and a lot of travel. AREA 5 has become very good at knowing how much a production is going to cost. Originally, we were thinking about showing a bunch of awful spreadsheets and writing walls of text to explain where the money is going. Fortunately, Braid artist David Hellman came to our rescue!
WHO'S MAKING IT?
AREA 5 is Ryan O'Donnell, Matt Chandronait, Jason Bertrand, Cesar Quintero, and Rick Curnutte. You can find out more about us on the AREA 5 web site. We're also collaborating with some INCREDIBLE people that are just as excited as we are to make this happen! And, if we hit our FREELANCERS STRETCH GOAL, there will be even more people added to the team!
IS IT ONLY ABOUT PRESERVING OLD GAMES? (ANSWER: NO!)
Game preservation is only one important topic—one which is particularly easy to tackle in the San Francisco Bay Area (where AREA 5 is located), which is why it's the featured example in our Kickstarter video. Our ambition is to explore every story that we can possibly afford to! To give you a better idea of what we're going for, this series is directly inspired by This American Life, Radiolab, Objectified and Helvetica, A Life Well Wasted, 99% Invisible, Polygon's Human Angle, State of Play, and, of course Indie Game: The Movie.
WHAT OTHER TOPICS WILL THE SERIES COVER?
It goes by pretty fast in the Kickstarter video, but there's a scene with a cloud of words in there. Those topics are just a taste of what's on our list. We can't even imagine the kinds of stories other minds can bring into the fold if we can get to our FREELANCERS STRETCH GOAL!  We will also be holding polls and surveys throughout the Kickstarter period to hear about topics YOU want to cover! 
A small sampling of topics we think will result in incredible stories
WILL YOU DELIVER THE EPISODES AS YOU FINISH THEM?
No. We know from experience that we'll get the absolute highest quality by shooting and editing everything together. Whether you're backing at a level that gets you the series digitally or on Blu-ray, you'll get the entire season as a package. Filming a documentary is about being there and we want to have the opportunity to film that last great story for episode 1 even if we're just finishing shooting for episode 6. Besides, who doesn't like to binge-watch TV these days?
WHEN WILL IT BE DONE?
We are predicting 18 months from the finish of the Kickstarter campaign. That is roughly mid-July of 2015. The first six months will be pre-production (research, scheduling, travel arrangements, legal, insurance) and production (the actual shooting). Post-production (the period where we do all the editing, add in graphics, mix the sound, produce and edit a soundtrack, and so forth) will happen afterward. Kickstarter rewards will be designed and updates posted throughout the 18-month cycle.
REWARDS
We are honored to be working with Humble Bundle and Fangamer for our backer rewards! They helped Double Fine Productions and Mighty No.9 on their Kickstarters, so you know we're working with the right folks to make sure you get your rewards on time and at the highest quality!
BACKERS-ONLY LIVESTREAM - We will hold live streams at a secret URL that only Kickstarter backers will get access to. In it we'll show you stuff we've shot, rough edits of stories we're working on, and get your feedback on where to go next! We'll also trot out deleted scenes from past AREA 5 content. Watch purely for entertainment, or get more involved and help us shape the series! OUTERLANDERS UNITE!
SOUNDTRACK (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD) - All the music used in the series! At the minimum this will include licensed tracks and original tracks from our collaborators, music created by AREA 5, and other original tunes. Help us hit our 100% ORIGINAL SOUNDTRACK STRETCH GOAL, and we'll have the funding to commission ALL original music for the series!
OUTERLANDS SEASON ONE (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD) - All finished episodes of the series in a handy download.
OUTERLANDS SEASON ONE SPECIAL EDITION (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD)- All finished episodes of the series in a handy download, plus extra content like full interviews, stories that didn't make the cut for the main series, behind-the-scenes, and anything else we can think of that is interesting or awesome! We even have ideas for setting unused footage to music and presenting just for artistic value.
POSTER (DIGITAL DOWNLOAD) - A high-resolution PDF that you can print out at your leisure and use for your own purposes.
STICKERS - Quality stickers featuring carefully designed artwork inspired by the subjects featured in the Outlerlands episodes.
POSTER - Designed by one of our fabulous collaborators, this Kickstarter-only Outerlands poster will never be printed again!
T-SHIRT - Designed by one of our fabulous collaborators, this Kickstarter-only Outerlands t-shirt will never be printed again!
LIMITED EDITION T-SHIRT - A limited-run, ultra-high-quality design on the very best, super soft T-Shirts! NUMBERED! Show your support by backing early!
LIMITED EDITION POSTERS - Extremely high-quality prints designed by Cory Schmitz on equally high-quality stock!
SPECIAL EDITION BLU-RAY - There is no "Regular Edition" Blu-ray. Contains everything in the digital Special Edition plus a surprise or two! We feel it's silly to offer the Special Edition digital reward and have a Regular Edition Blu-ray at a higher cost. Yet another Cory Schmitz original, this will be a work of art designed for shelf display!
THE AREA 5 FILM FESTIVAL! - A one-day event where we rent out a theater, showcase AREA 5 films and other random, never-before-seen content (quite frankly, stuff we CAN'T show anywhere else), as well as a curated list of other videogame-themed films and shows. There will be food, drinks, and presentations from creators, cast, and documentary subjects in between the showings. VIP access means reserved seating and any other discounts or free stuff we can line up for the day of the event—stuff we can't line up until funding is complete and the event is definitely on.
STRETCH GOALS
WHO'S IN THE KICKSTARTER VIDEO?
This is where we get to thank the amazing people who have thus far lent us so much of their time and are such huge believers in this project! To Jim Guthrie and Disasterpeace for the music, and for our first documentary subjects!
If you're ever even somewhat close to Alameda, California, do yourself a favor and head out to High Scores Arcade Interactive Museum. All games are on free play and it's only $5 for an hour or $10 for a whole freakin' day! The owners, Meg and Shawn, are the coolest people ever! Also in the video are Mike Mika and Frank Cifaldi from Other Ocean Interactive. Besides being great game developers, Mike and Frank have made enormous efforts to preserve games and gaming culture. That shot of Frank looking at old slides is in Mike's famous basement that many of us first learned about on Robert Ashley's incredible podcast A Life Well Wasted. Our filming with Frank, Meg, Shawn, and Mike is far from complete, but we're already well into our production thanks to their tremendous help! We've also shot at the Oakland M.A.D.E. museum—though it isn't featured explicitly in the Kickstarter video.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our production schedule is set for roughly 18 months. That's a long time and a lot can happen in that period, but AREA 5 has been in business for 5 years and in that time we've finished dozens of productions. From full-length documentaries, to trailers, mini-docs, and fictional shorts. We know exactly what it'll take to protect ourselves and our content while making this series.

The main risks for any film project are accidents—both to equipment and personnel. Of course we mitigate this as much as possible by taking out insurance as appropriate to every production, but that doesn't mean that catastrophic events can't occur that could cause us to lose some or all of our footage on a given trip to a foreign land. If this happens and our budget doesn't allow us a reshoot, we'll find other amazing stories to tell that will allow us to fulfill our promise to deliver the series on time.

Other than losing content on location, we have a triple, multi-location backup plan for all our content. Short of San Francisco falling into the ocean, we should be covered.

Finally—and this one's a doozy—we've heard tales of certain Kickstarters that have been funded and then had their largest backers deny/reverse the charges after the campaign is over. As you can imagine, this can be hugely devastating to a lean-and-mean documentary project. There's only so much contingency a budget can absorb before something has to slip. The worst we can imagine in this scenario is having to cut an episode.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
